revision.text:
{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Variables
|descr= This function returns true if all of the passed data elements are of the same type and value. One or more elements can be passed.
{{Feature|arma3|In {{arma3}}, see [[isEqualTo]].}}
'''NOTES:''' * This function is an improvement over the {{=}}{{=}} operator, because it can handle any data type in any combination. * For arrays, it returns true if both arrays hold the same elements in the same order. * If both values are undefined / nil / null, then this function will return true. * '''WARNING:''' EXTREMELY large strings (> 4k) or compiled code (from a file, for example) might not be properly compared if they are only different near the end of the file.
|s1= [anything1, anything2, â€¦, anythingN] call [[BIS_fnc_areEqual]]
|p1= anythingM: [[Anything]] - any [[:Category:Data_Types|data type]]
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>[0, "0"] call BIS_fnc_areEqual; // false [0, 1 + 1 - 2] call BIS_fnc_areEqual; // true [str 50, "50"] call BIS_fnc_areEqual; // true</sqf>
|seealso= [[isEqualTo]] [[BIS_fnc_areEqualNotNil]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Variables |descr= Swaps the values of two variables '''passed as [[String]]'''.
Nothing is returned as this function modifies the variables directly. |s1= [variableName1, variableName2] call [[BIS_fnc_swapVars]] |p1= variableName1: [[String]] |p2= variableName2: [[String]] |r1= [[Nothing]] |x1= private _a = 1; _b = 2; ["_a", "_b"] call BIS_fnc_swapVars; _a == 2; // true _b == 1; // true |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Variables
|descr= Add element to variable from someone's variable space.
|s1= [object, varName, element, global, inArray] call [[BIS_fnc_variableSpaceAdd]]
|p1= object: [[Object]] - Owner of variable space
|p2= varName: [[String]] - Name of variable
|p3= element: [[Anything]] - Element which will be added (must be of same type as variable)
|p4= global: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to save modified variable globally]]
|p5= inArray: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to check if element is already in variable (only for [[Array|arrays]])
|r1= [[Anything]] - Updated variable
|x1= <sqf>[player, "someVar", 1337, true, true] call BIS_fnc_variableSpaceAdd;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_variableSpaceRemove]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Variables
|descr= Remove element from variable from someone's variable space.
|s1= [object,varName,element,global,inArray] call [[BIS_fnc_variableSpaceRemove]]
|p1= object: [[Object]] - Owner of variable space
|p2= varName: [[String]] - Name of variable
|p3= element: [[Anything]] - Element which will be removed (must be of same type as variable) |p4= global: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to save modified variable globally]]
|r1= [[Anything]] - Updated variable
|x1= <sqf>[player, "someVar", 1337, true] call BIS_fnc_variableSpaceRemove;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_variableSpaceAdd]] [[setVariable]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Variables
|descr= Set variable stored only on server. Clients can the download it using [[BIS_fnc_getServerVariable]]. Used when you want to share variables only to specific clients to prevent large traffic.
|s1= [namespace, varName, value] call [[BIS_fnc_setServerVariable]]
|p1= namespace: [[Namespace]], [[Object]] or [[Group]] - (Optional, default [[missionNamespace]])
|p2= varName: [[String]] - variable name
|p3= value: [[Anything]] - variable value
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= <sqf>[nil, "playerHealth", damage player] call BIS_fnc_setServerVariable;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[player, "playerHealth", damage player] call BIS_fnc_setServerVariable;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_getServerVariable]] [[publicVariableServer]] [[publicVariableClient]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Variables
|descr= Fetch a variable saved on server. Used when you want to share variables only to specific clients to prevent large traffic. Must be run in [[Scheduler#Scheduled_Environment|scheduled environment]] because communication with server takes some time.
|s1= [target, varName, default] call [[BIS_fnc_getServerVariable]]
|p1= target: [[Namespace]], [[Object]] or [[Group]] - Variable name space
|p2= varName: [[String]] - Variable name
|p3= default: [[Anything]] - Default value returned when variable is [[nil]]
|r1= [[Anything]] - Default value or saved variable
|x1= <sqf>[missionNamespace, "BIS_someVar", "defaultValue"] call BIS_fnc_getServerVariable;</sqf>
|seealso= [[getVariable]] [[setVariable]] [[allVariables]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Compile scripts and save them into globally available functions. Defines [[_fnc_scriptName]] variable.
|s1= [fileDirectory, prefix, nameVars, global] call [[BIS_fnc_loadFunctions]]
|p1= fileDirectory: [[String]] - script path
|p2= prefix: [[String]] - variable prefix {{Feature|Informative|{{hl|"BIS_fnc_"}} prefix is reserved and cannot be used.}}
|p3= nameVars: [[Array]] of [[String]]s '''or''' [[Array]] of [[Array]] - list of variables to be declared. * [[Array]] of [[String]]s to format [variable, variable, â€¦] - final variable is {{hl|prefix + variable}}, loaded from {{hl|path + variable + ".sqf"}} * [[Array]] of [[Array]] to format [<nowiki/>[variable, fileName], [variable, fileName], â€¦] - final variable is {{hl|prefix + variable}}, loaded from {{hl|path + fileName + ".sqf"}}
|p4= global: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] for global persistent execution on all clients
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= <sqf>["scripts\myDir\", "MY_fnc_", ["script1", "script2"], true] call BIS_fnc_loadFunctions;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>["scripts\myDir\", "MY_fnc_", [["script1", "script1file"], ["script2", "script2file"]], false] call BIS_fnc_loadFunctions;</sqf>
|seealso= [[compile]] [[compileFinal]] [[preprocessFileLineNumbers]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Selects a random item from an array, taking into account item weight. {{Feature|informative| * The weights do not have to total to 1 * The length of weights and items arrays may not match, in which case the shortest array is used for length }}
{{Feature|arma3|See [[selectRandomWeighted]] for an engine solution.}}
|s1= itemsAndWeights call [[BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted]]
|p1= itemsAndWeights: [[Array]] - array of items and weights [item, weight, item, weight...]
|r1= [[Anything]]
|s2= [items, weights] call [[BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted]]
|p21= items: [[Array]] - items array of [[Anything]]
|p22= weights: [[Array]] - weights array of [[Number]]s
|r2= [[Anything]]
|x1= <sqf>["apples",.3,"pears",.2,"bananas",.4,"diamonds",.1,"unicorns",.00001] call BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[["apples","pears","bananas","diamonds"], [0.3,0.2,0.4,0.1]] call BIS_fnc_selectRandomWeighted;</sqf>
|seealso= [[selectRandomWeighted]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Function to find item in nested arrays and return a path to the first match. {{Feature|arma3|In some cases [[findIf]] might be the better way of finding a nested element. It is a lot faster!}}
|s1= [array, query] call [[BIS_fnc_findNestedElement]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - array to explore
|p2= query: [[Anything]] - wanted item
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Number]]s - path to the first occurence of ''query''
|x1= <sqf> private _array = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]; _path = [_array, 3] call BIS_fnc_findNestedElement; // expected result: [1, 0] // ((_array select 1) select 0) == 3 </sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_findAllNestedElements]] [[BIS_fnc_removeNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_returnNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_setNestedElement]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Function to return an item at a path in an array.
|s1= [array, path] call [[BIS_fnc_returnNestedElement]]
|p1= array: [[Array]]
|p2= path: [[Array]] of [[Number]]s
|r1= [[Anything]] - [[nil]] if path is incorrect
|x1= <sqf>private _array = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]; _value = [_array, [0, 1]] call BIS_fnc_returnNestedElement; // returns 2</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_findNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_findAllNestedElements]] [[BIS_fnc_removeNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_setNestedElement]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Function to set an item in a nested array using a path. Modifies the array by reference.
|s1= [array, path, value] call [[BIS_fnc_setNestedElement]]
|p1= array: [[Array]]
|p2= path: [[Array]] of [[Number]]s
|p3= value: [[Anything]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] on success, [[false]] on failure
|x1= <sqf> private _array = [[1, 2], [3, 4]]; _bool = [_array, [0, 0], 0] call BIS_fnc_setNestedElement; // _array is now [[0, 2], [3, 4]] </sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_findNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_findAllNestedElements]] [[BIS_fnc_removeNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_returnNestedElement]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Function to remove an item in a nested array. Modifies the array by reference.
|s1= [array, itemToRemove] call [[BIS_fnc_removeNestedElement]]
|p1= array: [[Array]]
|p2= itemToRemove: [[Anything]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] on success, [[false]] on failure
|x1= <sqf> private _array = [[1, 2], [3, 3, 4]]; private _success = [_array, 3] call BIS_fnc_removeNestedElement; // _array is now [[1, 2], [4]] </sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_findNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_findAllNestedElements]] [[BIS_fnc_returnNestedElement]] [[BIS_fnc_setNestedElement]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Function to return the maximum difference between all values in an array.
|s1= [arrayOfNumbers] call [[BIS_fnc_maxDiffArray]]
|p1= arrayOfNumbers: [[Array]] - numbers to be tested
|r1= [[Number]] - the biggest difference
|x1= <sqf>private _maxDiff = [[0, 5, 10, -5]] call BIS_fnc_maxDiffArray; // will return 15 (-5 to 10)</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Takes an array, and returns a new array with the specified index(es) removed. This takes the array passed in the first parameter, and returns an array that has the index number in the second parameter removed. If a third parameter is passed, then a range of indexes will be removed. Alternatively, an array of indices to remove can be passed in the second parameter.
{{Feature|arma3|Use [[deleteAt]] or [[deleteRange]] instead.}}
|s1= [array, startIndex, endIndex] call [[BIS_fnc_removeIndex]]
|p1= array: [[Array]]
|p2= startIndex: [[Number]] - start index to be removed, if {{Link|#Parameter 3}} is not provided, only this index is removed
|p3= endIndex: [[Number]] - (Optional, default [[Nothing]]) - end index, if provided the indexs from startIndex to endIndex will be removed
|r1= [[Array]] - new array with new values
|s2= [array, indices] call [[BIS_fnc_removeIndex]]
|p21= array: [[Array]]
|p22= indices: [[Array]] of [[Number]]s - indices to be removed
|r2= [[Array]] - new array with new values
|x1= <sqf> private _array = [0,1,2,3,4]; [array, 0] call BIS_fnc_removeIndex; // returns [1,2,3,4] </sqf>
|x2= <sqf> private _array = [0,1,2,3,4]; [_array, 0, 4] call BIS_fnc_removeIndex; // returns [] </sqf>
|x3= <sqf> private _array = [0,1,2,3,4]; [_array, [0,4]] call BIS_fnc_removeIndex; // returns [1,2,3] </sqf>
|seealso= [[deleteAt]] [[deleteRange]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Return a random integer representing an index in the passed array.
|s1= array call [[BIS_fnc_randomIndex]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] of [[Anything]]
|r1= [[Number]]
|x1= <sqf>["a", 0, objNull] call BIS_fnc_randomIndex; // returns 0, 1 or 2</sqf>
|seealso= [[floor]] [[count]] [[random]] [[selectRandom]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Arrays |descr= This function adds an element to the end of an array and returns the array.
'''The array is passed by reference''' so changes inside the function will be reflected outside of it. {{Feature|arma3|Use [[append]] or [[pushBack]] instead.}} |s1= [array, element] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayPush]] |p1= array: [[Array]] |p2= element: [[Anything]] |r1= [[Array]] - modified ''array'' |x1= _newArray = [[0,1,2], 3] call BIS_fnc_arrayPush; // _newArray is [0,1,2,3] |x2= private _array = [0,1,2]; [_array, [3]] call BIS_fnc_arrayPush; // _array is [0,1,2,[3]] |seealso= [[append]] [[pushBack]] [[BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= This function is similar to the array push function; however, it pushes the contents of an array onto the stack array. {{Feature|arma3|Use [[append]] or [[pushBack]] instead}}
|s1= [array1, array2] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack]]
|p1= array1: [[Array]]
|p2= array2: [[Array]]
|r1= [[Array]] - the modified ''array1''
|x1= <sqf> private _array = [0,1,2]; [_array, [3,4,5]] call BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack; // _array is [0,1,2,3,4,5] </sqf>
|x2= <sqf>private _array = [[5, 6, 7], [8, [9], 10]] call BIS_fnc_arrayPushStack; // _array is [5, 6, 7, 8, [9], 10]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_arrayPush]] [[pushBack]] [[append]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Arrays |descr= This function removes the last (rightmost) element of an array and returns it.
'''The array is passed by reference''' so changes inside the function will be reflected outside of it. |s1= array call [[BIS_fnc_arrayPop]] |p1= array: [[Array]] |r1= [[Anything]] - the removed array element |x1= private _array = [1,2,3,4]; _removedElement = _array call BIS_fnc_arrayPop; // _array is now [1,2,3] and _removedElement = 4 |seealso= [[deleteAt]] [[resize]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Arrays |descr= This function removes the first (leftmost) element of an array and returns it.
The array is passed by reference so changes inside the function will be reflected outside of it. {{Feature|arma3|In {{arma3}}, use array deleteAt 0.}} |s1= [array] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayShift]] |p1= array: [[Array]] - '''NOTE:''' given array must be within an array (e.g [[10, 20, 30]] call BIS_fnc_arrayShift) |r1= [[Anything]] - the removed element |x1= private _myArray = ["2", "report", "status"]; _removedElement = [_myArray] call BIS_fnc_arrayShift; // array is -within an array- _removedElement == "2"; // true _myArray isEqualTo ["report", "status"]; // true |seealso= [[deleteAt]] [[pushBack]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= This function adds an element to the beginning of an array and returns the array. The array is passed by reference so changes inside the function will be reflected outside of it.
|s1= [array, value] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift]]
|p1= array: [[Array]]
|p2= value: [[Anything]]
|r1= [[Array]] - ''array'' reference
|x1= <sqf>private _array = [2,3,4]; [_array, 1] call BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift; // _array is now [1,2,3,4]</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>private _array = [[2,3,4], 1] call BIS_fnc_arrayUnShift; // _array is now [1,2,3,4]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_arrayShift]] [[pushBack]] [[select]] [[set]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= This function checks if two arrays are containing the same elements in the same order. {{Feature|important|This function is deprecated in {{arma2}} as it fails with certain data types; see [[BIS_fnc_areEqual]] for {{arma2}}.}} {{Feature|arma3|Use [[isEqualTo]] instead.}}
|s1= [array1, array2] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayCompare]]
|p1= array1: [[Array]]
|p2= array2: [[Array]]
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf> private _array1 = [0,1,2]; private _array2 = [0,1,2]; [_array1, _array2] call BIS_fnc_arrayCompare; // returns true </sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_areEqual]] [[BIS_fnc_areEqualNotNil]] [[isEqualTo]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Searches an array for a specific value and returns its index.
|s1= [array,value] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayFindDeep]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - Array to be searched
|p2= value [[Anything]] - Value to be searched for
|r1= [[Array]] - Returns array with index of found element, if it was not found it returns -1
|x1= <sqf>[ [1,2,3,4,5], 3 ] call BIS_fnc_arrayFindDeep;//Returns [2]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] [[find]] [[select]] [[BIS_fnc_removeIndex]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= This returns a sub-array of elements that satisfy a specific condition '''in the order they have been passed'''. {{Feature|arma3|Since {{arma3}} v1.55, use <sqf inline>array select condition</sqf> instead.}}
In the condition, the currently tested element is assigned to the variable "[[Magic Variables#x|_x]]". The original array is '''not''' modified.
|s1= [items, condition] call [[BIS_fnc_conditionalSelect]]
|p1= items: [[Array]] - array to check
|p2= condition: [[Code]] - selection code
|r1= [[Array]]
|x1= <sqf>[[10, 0, 8, 2, 6, 4], { _x > 5 }] call BIS_fnc_conditionalSelect; // will return [10,8,6]</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[[10, true, 8, player], { typeName _x == "STRING" }] call BIS_fnc_conditionalSelect; // will return []</sqf>
|seealso= [[select]] [[count]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Returns a sub-selection of the passed array.
|s1= [array, start, endOrLength] call [[BIS_fnc_subSelect]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] array to select sub array from
|p2= start: [[Number]] index of array to begin sub-array. '''If negative''', index is counted from the end of array
|p3= endOrLength: [[Number]] - index of array to end the sub-array. If ommitted, remainder of the array will be selected. '''If negative''', it specifies the length of the sub-array (in absolute form)
|r1= [[Array]]
|x1= <sqf> private _array = ["a", "b", true, 3, 8]; [_array, 2] call BIS_fnc_subSelect; // returns [true,3,8] </sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[_array, -2] call BIS_fnc_subSelect; // returns [3,8]</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>[_array, 1, 3] call BIS_fnc_subSelect; // returns ["b",true,3]</sqf>
|x4= <sqf>[_array, 1, -2] call BIS_fnc_subSelect; // returns ["b",true]</sqf>
|seealso= [[select]] [[count]] [[selectRandom]] [[BIS_fnc_arrayShuffle]] [[BIS_fnc_randomIndex]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Inserts the elements of one array into another, at a specified index. Neither arrays are touched by reference, a new array is returned.
|s1= [array1, array2, index] call [[BIS_fnc_arrayInsert]]
|p1= array1: [[Array]] - array to insert into
|p2= array2: [[Array]] - array to be inserted
|p3= index: [[Number]] - insertion index
|r1= [[Array]] - a new array
|x1= <sqf>private _result = [[0,1,2,3,4], ["a","b","c"], 1] call BIS_fnc_arrayInsert; // returns [0,"a","b","c",1,2,3,4]</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Weapons
|descr= Returns class of weapon given by string.
|s1= weaponClass call [[BIS_fnc_classWeapon]]
|p1= weaponClass: [[String]]
|r1= [[Config]]
|x1= <sqf>private _weaponConfig = currentWeapon player call BIS_fnc_classWeapon;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_classMagazine]] [[isClass]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Returns class of magazine given by string.
|s1= magazineClass call [[BIS_fnc_classMagazine]]
|p1= magazineClass: [[String]]
|r1= [[Config]]
|x1= <sqf>private _magazineConfig = currentMagazine player call BIS_fnc_classMagazine;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_classWeapon]] [[isClass]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Explores parent classes in the run-time config for the value of a config entry.
|s1= [config,attribute,defaultValue] call [[BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry]]
|p1= config: [[Config]] - Starting config
|p2= attribute: [[String]] - Config attribute to be returned
|p3= defaultValue: [[Anything]] - (Optional, default [[Nothing]]) Value to be returned if attribute is not existent
|r1= [[Array]], [[String]] or [[Number]] - Attribute value
|x1= <sqf>[configfile >> "Cfg3DEN" >> "Attributes" >> "ActivationType","idc"] call BIS_fnc_returnConfigEntry;</sqf>
|seealso= [[configFile]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfg]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Returns list of all parent classes.
|s1= [config, onlyClassNames] call [[BIS_fnc_returnParents]]
|p1= config: [[Config]] - Starting config class
|p2= onlyClassNames: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to return only class names
|r1= [[Array]] - List of all classes (including starting one)
|x1= <sqf>[ configFile >> "CfgVehicles" >> "Land_FirePlace_F", true ] call BIS_fnc_returnParents; //Returns ["Land_FirePlace_F","House_F","House","HouseBase","NonStrategic","Building","Static","All"]</sqf>
|seealso= [[configFile]] [[BIS_fnc_returnChildren]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Displays or logs animation states: *'''animChanged''' - When action is performed (only to debug.log) *'''animDone''' - When animation chain that was started by action is finished (only to debug.log) *'''animStateChanged''' - Each animation state changes(debug.log + globalchat).
|s1= [target] call [[BIS_fnc_diagAnim]]
|p1= target: [[Object]] - (Optional, default [[player]]) - The unit whose animation should be logged "
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagAnim;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

revision.comment: Text replacement - "[[Script Handle|Script handle]]" to "[[Script Handle]]"
revision.text:
{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Diagnostic
|eff= local
|descr= Function to measure FPS. Spawns code running for given time and displays result on screen ''via'' [[titleText]], [[globalChat]] '''and''' [[diag_log]]. Variable '''BIS_fps_output''' is filled with [[diag_log]] content too.
|s1= [duration, sceneId, startDelay] call [[BIS_fnc_fps]]
|p1= duration: [[Number]] - the FPS test duration
|p2= sceneId: [[String]] - (Optional, default "") scene ID, used in outputs. Fills global variable '''currentScene'''
|p3= startDelay: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) delay before starting measurement
|r1= [[Script Handle]]
|x1= <sqf>private _scriptHandle = [10, "50 units on screen", 3] call BIS_fnc_fps;</sqf>
|seealso= [[diag_fps]] [[diag_fpsMin]] [[diag_frameNo]] [[diag_tickTime]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Geometry
|descr= Returns the relative direction from object 1 to object/position 2. Return value is always in between 0 and 360. {{Feature|arma3|Use [[getRelDir]] instead.}}
|s1= [from, to] call [[BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo]]
|p1= from: [[Object]]
|p2= to: [[Object]] or [[Array]] format [[Position]]
|r1= [[Number]]
|x1= <sqf>[[0,0,0], player] call BIS_fnc_relativeDirTo;</sqf>
|seealso= [[getPos]] [[getRelDir]] [[direction]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Positions
|gr2= Geometry
|descr= Returns a position that is a specified distance and compass direction from the passed position or object. {{Feature|arma3|In {{arma3}} use [[getPos]]' [[getPos#Syntax 3|alternative syntax]] instead.}}
|s1= [origin, distance, direction] call [[BIS_fnc_relPos]]
|p1= origin: [[Object]] or [[Position]] - object or position which should be used as initial point.
|p2= distance: [[Number]] - distance from initial point
|p3= direction: [[Number]] - direction from the intial position
|r1= [[Position]]
|x1= <sqf>[[0,0,0], 1000, 50] call BIS_fnc_relPos; // [766.044,642.788,0]</sqf>
|seealso= [[getPos]] }}
{{Note |user= Lawman Actual |timestamp= 20160107192600 |text= The function appears to work in two dimensions, and as such can be used to find the position of a target relative to the player if bearing and distance are known.
However, if there is a significant change in elevation between yourself and the target, the distance registered on a rangefinder (which is measuring in a 3-dimensional straight line) will always be larger than the two-dimensional value required for [[BIS_fnc_relPos]] and as such air-strikes and ordnance called in using such a function can miss by several hundred metres in extreme cases.
Currently searching for a method which incorporates the azimuth of the rangefinder in calculation. }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Geometry
|descr=Returns the distance between two [[Object|objects]] or [[Position|positions]]. {{Feature|arma3|Use [[distance2D]] instead.}}
|s1= [param1, param2] call [[BIS_fnc_distance2D]]
|p1= param1: [[Object]] or [[Array]] in format [[Position]] or [[Position#Introduction|Position2D]]
|p2= param2: [[Object]] or [[Array]] in format [[Position]] or [[Position#Introduction|Position2D]]
|r1= [[Number]] - Distance in meters or 1e10 if distance cannot be calculated
|x1= <sqf>[player, rescueHelicopter] call BIS_fnc_distance2D;</sqf>
|seealso= [[distance2D]] [[BIS_fnc_distance2Dsqr]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Geometry
|descr= Returns the SQUARE of the distance between the two objects or positions "as the crow flies" (ignoring elevation).
{{Feature|arma3|This function became obsolete with the introduction of [[distanceSqr]]}}
|s1= [Point_1,Point_2] call [[BIS_fnc_distance2Dsqr]]
|p1=Point_1: [[Object]] or [[Position]] |p2=Point_2: [[Object]] or [[Position]]
|r1= [[Number]] - Squared distance
|x1= <sqf>[ player, soldier_1 ] call BIS_fnc_distance2Dsqr</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[ [100,100,0],[0,0,0] ] call BIS_fnc_distance2Dsqr</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_distance2D]] [[distance2D]] [[distance]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Geometry |descr= Return the distance between two sections of a virtual straight line.

[[File:BIS_fnc_getLineDistSchema.png]] |s1= [start1, length1, start2, length2] call [[BIS_fnc_getLineDist]] |p1= start1: [[Number]] - segment 1 beginning. Can be negative |p2= length1: [[Number]] - segment 1 length. Can be negative |p3= start2: [[Number]] - segment 2 beginning. Can be negative |p4= length2: [[Number]] - segment 2 length. Can be negative |r1= [[Number]] |x1= private _distance = [0,5,15,20] call BIS_fnc_getLineDist; // returns 10 |seealso= [[distance]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr= Returns inventory contents of given vehicle (unit). For vehicles it returns mounted gun and its ammo, '''not''' cargo weapons and ammo.
|s1= [unit] call [[BIS_fnc_inv]]
|p1= unit: [[Object]] - unit or vehicle
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Config]] - weapons then magazines
|x1= <sqf>[player] call BIS_fnc_inv;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Adds item to inventory - checks if there is room for it. Checks if add was done by engine.
|s1= [object,class,force] call [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]]
|p1=object: [[Object]]
|p2=class: [[String]] - Item class to be added
|p3=force: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to force add item, other items might be removed
|r1= [[Boolean]] or [[Array]] - [[true]] when successfull, [[Array]] if force is set to [[true]] and items were removed (retuns items)
|x1= <sqf>[ player,"someClass" ] call BIS_fnc_invAdd;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Removes from inventory. Given number of items. Returns actually removed items count.
|s1= [object,class,count] call [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]]
|p1=object: [[Object]]
|p2=class: [[String]] - Item class to be added
|p3=count: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1) Number of items to be removed
|r1= [[Number]] - Number of items which were removed
|x1= <sqf>[ player,"someClass",5 ] call BIS_fnc_invRemove;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Converts inventory code (used in configs) to array with numbers for weapons and magazines (and their counts).
|s1= [configCode] call [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]]
|p1=configCode: [[Number]] - Config code, see example
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Number|numbers]] - Items slots numbers
|x1= <sqf>[ call compile getText (configfile >> "CfgVehicles" >> typeOf player >> "weaponSlots")] call BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray;//Can return [1,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Returns inventory contents of given vehicle (unit).
Note: for vehicles it returns mounted gun and its ammo, not cargo weapons and ammo.
|s1= [object] call [[BIS_fnc_invString]]
|p1=object: [[Object]]
|r1= [[Array]] - Weapons and magazines
|x1= <sqf>[ player ] call BIS_fnc_invString;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Returns config inventory slots of given unit (total numbers of available slots in array).
|s1= [object] call [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]]
|p1=object: [[Object]]
|r1= [[Array]] - Array with total available slots of all types that are given by config
|x1= <sqf>[ player ] call BIS_fnc_invSlots;//Returns [1,1,1,8,12,1,0,12] for "B_T_Recon_TL_F" class. Means: 1 x WeaponSlotPrimary, 1 x WeaponSlotHangun, ... , 12 x WeaponSlotInventory</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Returns empty inventory slots of given unit.
|s1= [object] call [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]]
|p1=object: [[Object]]
|r1= [[Array]] - Array with empty slots
|x1= <sqf>[ player ] call BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty;//Can return [0,0,-1,-7,0,-1,0,-12]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]] [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Inventory
|descr=Returns empty inventory slots of given unit.
|s1= [class] call [[BIS_fnc_invSlotType]]
|p1=class: [[String]] - Inventory item
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Number|numbers]] - Numbers representing slots taken by given item (one item can take more slots of same or different type), empty if type 0 or not found
|x1= <sqf>[ currentWeapon player ] call BIS_fnc_invSlotType;//Can return [1,0,0,0,0,0,0,0]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_invRemove]] [[BIS_fnc_invCodeToArray]] [[BIS_fnc_invString]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlots]] [[BIS_fnc_invSlotsEmpty]] [[BIS_fnc_invAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Positions |descr= This function generates position on a map according to several given parameters (see diagram). [[Image:bis_fnc_findsafepos.jpg|600px|thumb|Diagram]] The position '''pos''' will be generated inside an area which resides between '''minDist''' and '''maxDist''' from the given '''center'''. If '''objDist''' is also specified, the position will be selected '''objDist''' away from nearest terrain object. If '''maxGrad''' > 0 then the position will be also checked for how flat the area around is within '''objDist''' radius. The function can additionally be instructed to generate position specifically on water or land ('''waterMode''') or on a shoreline ('''shoreMode'''). The '''shoreLine''' param will be ignored if position is not requested specifically on land.

Additionally, generated position could be checked against the list of blacklisted positions '''blacklistPos'''. If search for suitable position failed, '''defaultPos''' position will be used. The format for '''defaultPos''' is array with 2 positions: [posOnLand, posOnWater]. |s1= [center, minDist, maxDist, objDist, waterMode, maxGrad, shoreMode, blacklistPos, defaultPos] call [[BIS_fnc_findSafePos]] |p1= center: (Optional, default []) center position. Can be one of: * [[Array]] - position in format [[Position#Introduction|Position2D]] or [[Position#Introduction|Position3D]] * [[Object]] - object which position will be used * [[Nothing]] - when passing empty array [] or nothing, the world's "safePositionAnchor" entry will be used |p2= minDist: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) minimum distance from the center position |p3= maxDist: [[Number]] - (Optional, default -1) maximum distance from the center position. If -1, the world's "safePositionRadius" entry will be used |p4= objDist: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) minimum distance from the resulting position to the center of nearest object. Specifying quite large distance here will slow the function and might often fail to find suitable position. Recommended value: 0..10 |p5= waterMode: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) water mode. Can be one of: * 0 - cannot be in water * 1 - can either be in water or not * 2 - must be in water |p6= maxGrad: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) maximum terrain gradient (hill steepness). A quite small non-zero value could result in failure to find suitable position. Recommended: 0.1+ |p7= shoreMode: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) shore mode. Can be one of: * 0 - does not have to be at a shore * 1 - must be at a shore |p8= blacklistPos: [[Array]] - (Optional, default []) list of blacklisted areas in format [area1, area2, area3... areaN]. Can be one of: * [[Array]] - in format [topLeftCorner, bottomRightCorner] - top and bottom coordinates of blacklisted area * [[Object]] - trigger area * [[String]] - marker area * [[Location]] - location * [[Array]] - array in format [center, distance] or [center, a, b, angle, rect] or [center, a, b, angle, rect, height] |p9= defaultPos: [[Array]] - (Optional, default []) default position when no position is found. Array format is [landPosition, seaPosition], where: * landPosition: [[Array]] - in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] - default position on land * seaPosition: [[Array]] - in format [x,y] or [x,y,z] - default position on water |r1= [[Array]] - in format [x,y] on success. When position cannot be found at all, default map center position is returned, which will be in format [x,y,0] |x1= Find position minimum 1m from from player but not further than 150m, not closer than 3m to any other object, not in the water, maximum gradient of 20, not on the shoreline: private _pos = [player, 1, 150, 3, 0, 20, 0] call BIS_fnc_findSafePos; |x2= private _pos = [getPos player, 2000, 5000, 1, 0, 0.7, 0, [], [getPos player, getPos player]] call BIS_fnc_findSafePos; |x3= private _pos = [[], 0, 1000] call BIS_fnc_findSafePos; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_randomPosTrigger]] [[BIS_fnc_randomPos]] }} {{Note |user= Killzone_Kid |timestamp= 20170315193000 |text= To make sure position is not inside a building, increase distance to nearest object param. }} {{Note |user= AgentRev |timestamp= 20210924222305 |text= If ''objDist'' > 0, this function will unfortunately treat all roads and trails seen on the map as obstacles to avoid, due to its unfiltered usage of [[nearestTerrainObjects]]. }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Sides
|descr= Gets list and sides of current factions.
|s1= [parameter] call [[BIS_fnc_getFactions]]
|p1= parameter: * [[Nothing]] or empty [[Array]] - returns all factions * [[Object]] - returns index of the object side * [[Array]] - [[side]] of the first element is returned, others are ignored
|r1= * [[Array]] of [[String]]s * [[Array]] of [[Side]]s * [[Number]] - an index
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_getFactions; // returns all factions</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_getFactions; // same as Example 1</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>[player] call BIS_fnc_getFactions; // returns index of player's faction</sqf>
|x4= <sqf>["BLU_F"] call BIS_fnc_getFactions; // returns index of given faction</sqf>
|x5= <sqf>[[]] call BIS_fnc_getFactions; // will return all faction sides</sqf>
|x6= <sqf>[[player]] call BIS_fnc_getFactions; // will return player's side</sqf>
|seealso= [[faction]] [[side]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Object Manipulation
|descr= Detects whether position is within area '''or''' calculates distance to the nearest edge of trigger area by using optional params. {{Feature|arma3|Since {{arma3}} v1.57 [[inArea]] is available for an area check.}}
|s1= [area, position, returnDistance, includeFloorCeiling] call [[BIS_fnc_inTrigger]]
|p1= area: [[Object]], [[String]], [[Location]] or [[Array]] * [[Object]] - trigger * [[String]] - marker * [[Location]] - location * [[Array]] - in format [center, distance] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect]] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect, height]]
|p2= position: [[Object]] or [[Array]] - Position to check (e.g. [[player]]) or [[Position]]
|p3= returnDistance: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to return distance to nearest edge of trigger area
|p4= includeFloorCeiling: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) to include trigger area floor and ceiling in calculation when calculating distance to nearest edge
|r1= * [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when position is in area, false if not * [[Number]] - (when ''returnDistance'' is [[true]]) - distance from closest border: negative distance - from inside, positive distance - from outside
|x1= <sqf> private _trigger = createTrigger ["EmptyDetector", getPosATL player]; _trigger setTriggerArea [10, 10, 0, false]; _inTrigger = [_trigger, player] call BIS_fnc_inTrigger; // _inTrigger = true </sqf>
|seealso= [[createTrigger]] [[createMarker]] [[setTriggerArea]] [[setMarkerSize]] [[triggerArea]] [[markerSize]] [[inArea]] [[inAreaArray]] [[BIS_fnc_getArea]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Positions
|descr= Function checks a blacklist and sees if the given position is in it or not.
|s1= [position, blacklistArea] call [[BIS_fnc_isPosBlacklisted]]
|p1= position: [[Array]] format [[Position]]
|p2= blacklistArea: * [[Array]] of [[Position]]s - array to format [topLeft, bottomRight] * [[Object]] - a trigger. Check the trigger area (see [[inArea]] or [[BIS_fnc_inTrigger]])
|r1= [[Boolean]] - is the position blacklisted or not
|x1= <sqf>[[50,50], [[0,0], [100,100]]] call BIS_fnc_isPosBlacklisted;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[getPosATL player, myTrigger] call BIS_fnc_isPosBlacklisted;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_inTrigger]] [[inArea]] [[distance2D]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Multiplayer
|descr= Returns a list of ''currently played'' units, alive or dead.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_listPlayers]]
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Object]]s
|x1= <sqf>private _allPlayers = call BIS_fnc_listPlayers;</sqf>
|seealso= [[isPlayer]] [[playableUnits]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Positions
|descr= Converts array position to map grid position. {{Feature|obsolete|This function is replaced by [[mapGridPosition]].|arma2|1.04}}
|s1= element call [[BIS_fnc_posToGrid]]
|p1= element: [[Object]], [[Array]] in format [[Position]] or [[String]] marker name
|r1= [[Array]] of [[String]]s - format ["X", "Y"]
|x1= <sqf>player call BIS_fnc_posToGrid; // ["046", "049"]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_gridToPos]] [[mapGridPosition]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Positions
|descr= Function to find the nearest Object or position from a list, when compared to a given reference.
|s1= [items, origin] call [[BIS_fnc_nearestPosition]]
|p1= items: [[Array]] of [[Object]], [[Location]], [[Group]], [[String]] (marker) '''and/or''' [[Position]] - note that for a group, '''leader's position''' is used
|p2= origin: [[Object]], [[Location]], [[Group]], [[String]] (marker) or [[Position]]
|r1= [[Object]], [[Location]], [[Group]], [[String]] (marker) or [[Position]] - the closest from ''items''
|x1= <sqf>// Find the nearest marker from player _nearestMarker = [allMapMarkers, player] call BIS_fnc_nearestPosition;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>// Find the nearest marker to trigger using trigger onActivation code _nearestMarker = [allMapMarkers, thisTrigger] call BIS_fnc_nearestPosition;</sqf>
|seealso= [[nearObjects]] [[nearestObject]] [[nearestObjects]] [[BIS_fnc_nearestPoint]] [[BIS_fnc_nearestNum]] [[BIS_fnc_nearestRoad]] [[BIS_fnc_nearestHelipad]] [[BIS_fnc_isPosBlacklisted]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Communication Menu |descr= 
/*
	File: fn_createMenu.sqf

	Description:
	Create custom commanding menu (with multiple pages if necessary).

	Parameter(s):
		_this select 0 - STRING or ARRAY - Name of menu or [Name, Context sensitive]
		_this select 1 - STRING - Variable in which will be menu params stored (as variable_0, variable_1, ...)
		_this select 2 - ARRAY - Array with menu items (can be either [items] or [[items],[itemNames],[itemEnable]] if you want to set custom params (names, enable values))
		_this select 3 - STRING - Name of submenu which will open when item is activated. Name of selected item is passed to string as %1
		_this select 4 - STRING - Expression which is executed when item is activated. Name of selected item is passed to string as %1, ID is %2.
		_this select 5 - ANYTHING (Optional) - params passed to expression. Whole argument is passed as %3
		_this select 6 - BOOLEAN - False to hide number shortcuts

	Returned value(s):
		True
		
	Example:
	  c = ["first","second"]; ["Menu", "b", c, "","hint 'ahoj'"] call BIS_FNC_createmenu; showCommandingMenu "#USER:b_0"  
	  c = [["firstData","secondData"],["First","Second"]]; ["Menu", "b", c, "","hint (str '%1' + str '%2' + str '%3')"] call BIS_FNC_createmenu;  showCommandingMenu "#USER:b_0";
	  see news:g7p3po$gik$1@new-server.localdomain
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50
|game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00
|game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Converts RGB color format to HTML color format.
|s1= colorArray call [[BIS_fnc_colorRGBtoHTML]]
|p1= colorArray: [[Color|Color (RGBA)]] - can be [r, g, b, a] or [r, g, b], alpha value will be ignored in both cases
|r1= [[String]] - format #{{Color|red|RR}}{{Color|green|GG}}{{Color|blue|BB}}
|x1= <sqf>private _htmlColor = [0,0,0,1] call BIS_fnc_colorRGBtoHTML; // will return #000000</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>private _htmlColor = [2,93,0,1] call BIS_fnc_colorRGBtoHTML; // will return #025D00</sqf>
|seealso= [[Color|Color (RGBA)]] [[BIS_fnc_colorConfigToRGBA]] [[BIS_fnc_colorRGBAtoHTML]] [[BIS_fnc_colorRGBAtoTexture]] }}

{{RV|type=function

{{RV|type=function

|p1= array: [[Array]] of [[Number]]s
|r1= [[Array]] - sorted array

|seealso= [[sort]] [[BIS_fnc_randomInt]] [[BIS_fnc_geometricMean]] [[BIS_fnc_arithmeticMean]] [[BIS_fnc_nearestNum]] [[BIS_fnc_roundNum]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma2oa |version2= 1.50 |game3= tkoh |version3= 1.00 |game4= arma3 |version4= 0.50 |gr1= Object Manipulation |arg= global |descr= Returns the pitch and bank of an object, in degrees. '''Yaw''' can be found using the [[getDir]] command.
'''Pitch''' is 0 when the object is level; 90 when pointing straight up; and -90 when pointing straight down.
'''Bank''' is 0 when level; 90 when the object is rolled to the right, -90 when rolled to the left, and 180 when rolled upside down. {{Feature|important|The '''bank''' returned by this command is not fully accurate, it can be off by up to 5% or so (depending on pitch) due to an unknown bug.}} |s1= object call [[BIS_fnc_getPitchBank]] |p1= object: [[Object]] |r1= [[Array]] of [[Number]]s - format [pitch, bank] |x1= private _pitchBank = vehicle player call BIS_fnc_getPitchBank; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_setPitchBank]] [[vectorDir]] [[vectorUp]] [[setVectorDirAndUp]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00

|seealso= }}
