|s1= param call [[BIS_fnc_randomPosTrigger]]
|p1= param: can be one of: * [[Object]] - trigger * [[String]] - marker * [[Location]] - location * [[Array]] - array in format [center, distance] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect]] or [center, [a, b, angle, rect, height]]
|r1= [[Array]] - random position in format [x,y,z]
|x1= <sqf>marker1 call BIS_fnc_randomPosTrigger;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_findSafePos]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50 |gr1= Map and Markers |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Creates marker with given params.
	Reads config to recognize settings - use for quick debugging only.

	Parameter(s):
	_this: ARRAY of values:
		STRING - one of type, color, brush or shape. If no corresponding class is found, value is used as marker text
		ARRAY
			[STRING(,ANY,ANY,...)] - marker name with optional arguments
			[NUMBER] - marker size [a,a]
			[NUMBER,NUMBER] - marker size [x,y]
			[NUMBER,NUMBER,NUMBER] - marker position [x,y,z]
		OBJECT - object's position
		NUMBER - marker dir
		BOOL - marker locality (true if global)

	Returns:
	STRING - created marker
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Map and Markers
|descr= Returns marker params in format compatible with [[BIS_fnc_markerCreate]].
|s1= varName call [[BIS_fnc_markerParams]]
|p1= varName: [[String]] - Variable name of the marker
|r1= [[Array]] - Marker parameters *0: [[Array]] with [[String]] - Variable name of the marker *1: [[Array]] - Position of the marker *2: [[Array]] - Size *3: [[String]] - Colour *4: [[String]] - Type *5: [[String]] - Brush *6: [[String]] - Shape *7: [[Number]] - Alpha *8: [[String]] - Name of the marker
|x1= <sqf>private _params = "marker_1" call BIS_fnc_markerParams;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_markerCreate]] }} ||
<dl class="command_description">
<dt></dt> <dd class="notedate">Posted on February 27, 2021 - 16:30 (UTC)</dd> <dt class="note">[[User:7erra|7erra]]</dt> <dd class="note"> Extract all marker information from marker_1 to variables: <sqf>("marker_1" call BIS_fnc_markerParams) params ["_nameArray", "_position", "_size", "_colour", "_type", "_brush", "_shape", "_alpha", "_text"]; _position params ["_posX", "_posY"]; _nameArray params ["_marker"]; _size params ["_a", "_b"];</sqf> </dd>
</dl>

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Map and Markers
|eff= global
|descr= Create marker(s) between two points.
|s1= [start, end, spacing, params] call [[BIS_fnc_markerPath]]
|p1= start: [[Position]], [[Waypoint]], [[Object]], [[Location]] or [[String]]: * [[Position]] - position [x,y] or [x,y,z] * [[Waypoint]] - format [group, index] * [[Object]] - object's position * [[Location]] - location's position * [[String]] - marker name
|p2= end: same as ''start''
|p3= spacing: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1000) distance between markers. When value is negative, line marker is used instead with thickness of this value
|p4= params: [[Array]] - (Optional, default ["BIS_fnc_markerPath_marker_''#''", "mil_triangle", "colorgreen"]) marker params (see [[BIS_fnc_markerCreate]] for details)
|r1= [[Array]] - list of created markers
|x1= <sqf>["markerStart", "markerEnd"] call BIS_fnc_markerPath;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[player, nearestLocation [getPos player, "nameCity"]] call BIS_fnc_markerPath;</sqf>
|seealso= [[createMarker]] [[BIS_fnc_markWaypoints]] }}

{{RV|type=function

|p2= radius: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 999999) Radius of the area to search in meters

|r1= [[Array]] in format: * 0: [[Position]] - Position of the selected location * 1: [[Object]] - Helipad * 2: [[Position]] - Position of the helipad

|seealso= [[nearestObjects]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50 |gr1= Event Handlers |descr= Register code to be executed after a mission load (from a save, for example). {{Feature|important|Replaced by [[Arma 3: Mission Event Handlers#Loaded|"loaded" mission event handler]].
This function now exists only because of backward compatibility}} |s1= parameter call [[BIS_fnc_onLoad]] |p1= parameter: [[Code]] or [[Number]]: * [[Code]] - code to be executed on mission load * [[Number]] - index of code to remove   |r1= [[Number]] - index of onLoad code |x1= private _codeIndex = { hint "Welcome back!"; } call BIS_fnc_onLoad; |x2= 0 call BIS_fnc_onLoad; // removes code with index 0 |seealso= [[Arma 3: Mission Event Handlers|Mission Event Handlers]] [[addMissionEventHandler]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50 |gr1= Event Handlers |descr= Register code to be executed after mission end. {{Feature|arma3| Replaced by [[Arma 3: Mission Event Handlers#Ended|"Ended" mission event handler]].
This function now exists only because of backward compatibility. }} |s1= argument call [[BIS_fnc_onEnd]] |p1= argument: [[Code]], [[Array]] or [[Number]]: * [[Code]] - code to be executed * [[Array]] - code with arguments in format [code, arguments] * [[Number]] - remove code at given index |r1= [[Number]] - index of onEnd code |x1= private _onEndIndex = { player addRating 10000; } call BIS_fnc_onEnd; |x2= private _onEndIndex = [{ { _x addRating 10000; } forEach _this; }, units group player] call BIS_fnc_onEnd; |seealso= [[Event Scripts]] [[Arma 3: Mission Event Handlers#Ended|Ended Mission Event Handler]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Math
|descr= Round direction to nearest set rounding; used for determining cardinal direction.
|s1= [rawDirection, rounding] call [[BIS_fnc_roundDir]]
|p1= rawDirection: [[Number]] - direction to round
|p2= rounding: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 90) - rounding value. With 90Â° possible return values are 0, 90, 180 and 270
|r1= [[Number]] - rounded direction, depending on input. '''Can be negative or over 360'''
|x1= <sqf>player setDir ([getDir player, 45] call BIS_fnc_roundDir);</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[204.2, 10] call BIS_fnc_roundDir; // will return 200</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>[271, 180] call BIS_fnc_roundDir; // will return 360</sqf>
|x4= <sqf>70 call BIS_fnc_roundDir; // will return 90</sqf>
|seealso= [[setDir]] [[getRelDir]] [[round]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50

|s1= [objects] call [[BIS_fnc_saveGame]]
|p1= objects: [[Array]] - Units to check
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if saved

|seealso= [[saveGame]] [[loadGame]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00 |game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50 |gr1= Object Manipulation |descr= Function that returns a categorized array using a single string with the animation name. |s1= param call [[BIS_fnc_animType]] |p1= [[String]] - Animation name. |r1= [[Array]] - Sorted arrays within an array with details about animation. |x1= animType = ["AmovPsitMstpSrasWrflDnon"] call BIS_fnc_animType; // Returns [["Action","Move"],["Pose","Sit"],["Movement","Stop"],["Stance","Raised"],["Hand item","Rifle"],["Direction","Not specified"]] |seealso= }}
Posted on October 1, 2014 - 20:26 (UTC)
[[User:Tryteyker-|Tryteyker-]]
The categorization is identical to that of the animation viewer, minus the direction array.
So if the animation you are running through this function is found in the following categories: 
Action: Move
Pose: Erect
Movement: Stop
Stance: Raised
Weapon: Rifle
Then the following array will be returned: [["Action", "Move"], ["Pose", "Erect"], ["Movement", "Stop"], ["Stance", "Raised"], ["Hand item", "Rifle"], ["Direction", "Not specified"]];

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Object Manipulation
|eff= local
|descr= Ensures the player can only get in the specific vehicle role.
|s1= [vehicle, role, path] call [[BIS_fnc_assignPlayerRole]]
|p1= vehicle: [[Object]] - targeted vehicle
|p2= role: [[String]] - can be one of: * "driver" * "gunner" * "commander" * "cargo" * "turret"
|p3= path: [[Array]] or [[Number]]s - the turret path
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= <sqf>[myVehicle, "turret", [0, 1]] call BIS_fnc_assignPlayerRole;</sqf>
|seealso= [[assignAsDriver]] [[assignAsGunner]] [[assignAsCommander]] [[assignAsCargo]] [[assignAsTurret]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Math
|descr= Converts values to a target system of units.
|s1= [value, from, to, mode, precision] call [[BIS_fnc_convertUnits]]
|p1= value: [[Number]] - source value
|p2= from: [[Number]] - source unit. Can be one of: * 0: m (meters) * 1: km (kilometers) * 2: ms (meters per second) * 3: kmh (kilometers per hour) * 4: ft (feet) * 5: mi (miles) * 6: fts (feet per second) * 7: mph (miles per hour) * 8: nm (nautical miles) * 9: kts (knots)
|p3= to: [[Number]] - (Optional, default detected system of units ''via'' [[systemOfUnits]]) destination unit. See ''from''.
|p4= mode: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) can be one of: * 0: destination value (Scalar) * 1: destination text long (String) e.g "5 meters" * 2: destination text short (String) e.g "5 m"
|p5= precision: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1) destination precision factor, -1 for no precision change. '''cannot be 0'''
|r1= [[Number]] or [[String]] - converted value
|x1= <sqf>private _distString = [500, 0, 5, 1, -1] call BIS_fnc_convertUnits;</sqf>
|seealso= [[systemOfUnits]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Object Manipulation
|arg= local
|descr= Moves a unit into vehicle. Compatible with [[assignedVehicleRole]] output.
|s1= [vehicle, unit, role] call [[BIS_fnc_moveIn]]
|p1= vehicle: [[Object]]
|p2= unit: [[Object]] - the unit to move into ''vehicle'' - must be [[Multiplayer Scripting#Locality|local]]
|p3= role: [[Array]] - wanted seat, in format [''"role"''] or [''"role"'', turretPath]. Can be one of: * "driver" * "gunner" * "commander" * "cargo" * "turret" * "": will load ''unit'' in the first available seat (using [[moveInAny]])
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if moved in successfully
|x1= <sqf>[myCar, player, "cargo"] call BIS_fnc_moveIn;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[myTank, player, ["turret", [0]]] call BIS_fnc_moveIn;</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>[myTank, player, ["turret", -1]] call BIS_fnc_moveIn; // will moveInDriver the player</sqf>
|seealso= [[moveInDriver]] [[moveInGunner]] [[moveInCommander]] [[moveInCargo]] [[moveInTurret]] [[moveInAny]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Object Manipulation
|descr= Set an object's altitude.
|s1= [target, height, position, mode] call [[BIS_fnc_setHeight]]
|p1= target: [[Object]] - affected object
|p2= height: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) height to set
|p3= position: [[Position]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>position target</sqf>) position to place the target with calculated height
|p4= mode: [[String]] - (Optional, default "ROADWAY") can be: * "ROADWAY": uses [[setPos]] * "ASL": uses [[setPosASL]] * "ATL": uses [[setPosATL]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|s2= [height, mode] call [[BIS_fnc_setHeight]] {{Feature|important|This syntax uses <sqf inline>this</sqf> and is therefore meant to be used in init fields. Not to be used in MP.}}
|p21= height: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) height to set
|p22= mode: [[String]] - (Optional, default "ROADWAY") can be: * "ROADWAY": uses [[setPos]] * "ASL": uses [[setPosASL]] * "ATL": uses [[setPosATL]]
|r2= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= <sqf> // will place player's vehicle on "myHeightMarker", 50m above terrain [vehicle player, 50, getMarkerPos "myHeightMarker", "ATL"]]] call BIS_fnc_setHeight; </sqf>
|x2= <sqf> // will set the "this" object 50m above sea level at its position // use where "this" has a value like in an init field [50, "ASL"] call BIS_fnc_setHeight; </sqf>
|seealso= [[setPos]] [[setPosASL]] [[setPosATL]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Multiplayer
|descr= Execute received remote execution. This function is used by [[BIS_fnc_MP]] and should not be called directly. {{Feature | arma3 | Obsolete and ''completely'' effectless (empty file) since {{GVI|arma3|1.52}} and introduction of [[remoteExec]]/[[remoteExecCall]].}} {{Feature | Informative | This page is about {{tkoh}} and {{arma3}} < 1.52.}}
|s1= [packetName, packetValue] call [[BIS_fnc_MPexec]]
|p1= packetName: [[String]] - packet variable name - always "BIS_fnc_MP_packet" (not used in the function)
|p2= packetValue: [[Array]] - format [params, functionName, target, isSpawn, isPersistent]. Packet sent by [[BIS_fnc_MP]]; see its page for more details
|r1= [[Boolean]] - true if function was executed successfully
|x1= <sqf>["BIS_fnc_MP_packet", ["Hello World", "hint", true, true]] call BIS_fnc_MPexec;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_MP]] [[remoteExec]] [[remoteExecCall]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Arrays
|gr2= Strings
|descr= Break number into array of digits.
|s1= number call [[BIS_fnc_numberDigits]]
|p1= number: [[Number]] - Number that should be broken down. A float will be '''truncated''', not rounded
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Number]]s - Array of ''number'' digits
|x1= <sqf>12345678 call BIS_fnc_numberDigits; // returns [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8]</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>123.9999 call BIS_fnc_numberDigits; // returns [1,2,3]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_numberText]] [[BIS_fnc_cutDecimals]] }} |
<dl class="command_description">
<dt></dt> <dd class="notedate">Posted on March 20, 2018 - 21:25 (UTC)</dd> <dt class="note">[[User:vabene1111|vabene1111]]</dt> <dd class="note"> Use this function with caution: Numbers with more than 8 digits will return wrong results <sqf>[11111111] call BIS_fnc_numberDigits; // returns [1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1] [111111111] call BIS_fnc_numberDigits; // returns [1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,2] [1111111111111] call BIS_fnc_numberDigits; // returns [1,1,1,1,1,1,1,1,0,6,5,6,0]</sqf>
</dl>

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Math
|gr2= Strings
|descr= Convert a number into string (avoiding scientific notation).
|pr= It is very imprecise with larger numbers. See {{HashLink|#Example 3}}. It also does not work with floating point numbers.
|s1= [number, modulo] call [[BIS_fnc_numberText]]
|p1= number: [[Number]]
|p2= modulo: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 3)
|r1= [[String]]
|x1= <sqf>[4096] call BIS_fnc_numberText; // "4 096"</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[512, 1] call BIS_fnc_numberText; // "5 1 2"</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>[999999999999] call BIS_fnc_numberText; // "909 999 995 904"</sqf>
|x4= <sqf>[1234.5678] call BIS_fnc_numberText; // "1 234"</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_numberDigits]] [[BIS_fnc_cutDecimals]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= Strings
|descr= Convert seconds to formatted string.
|s1= [totalSeconds, format, returnArray] call [[BIS_fnc_secondsToString]]
|p1= totalSeconds: [[Number]] - time in seconds (see [[time]])
|p2= format: [[String]] - (Optional, default "HH:MM:SS") can be one of: * "HH" * "HH:MM" * "HH:MM:SS" * "HH:MM:SS.MS" * "MM" * "MM:SS" * "MM:SS.MS" * "SS.MS" ''HH = Hours, MM = Minutes, SS = Seconds, MS = Milliseconds''
|p3= returnArray: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default false)
|r1= [[String]] or [[Array]] of [[String]]s if ''returnArray'' is set to [[true]]
|x1= <sqf>hint format ["Hi, it is currently %1.", [time, "HH:MM"] call BIS_fnc_secondsToString];</sqf>
|seealso= [[time]] [[BIS_fnc_showTime]] [[BIS_fnc_timeToString]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Ambient
|descr= Spawns an air unit that moves from point A to point B, never engaging nor being engaged. It is set as captive and will despawn once it reaches its destination. {{Feature | Informative | Created vehicle is [[setCaptive|set captive]], making its side [[civilian]].}}
|s1= [startPos, endPos, altitude, speedMode, classname, side] call [[BIS_fnc_ambientFlyby]]
|p1= startPos: [[Position]] - start position of the air unit. The Z value does not matter and is replaced by ''altitude''
|p2= endPos: [[Array]] format [[Position#PositionAGL|PositionAGL]] - end position where the air unit moves to and despawns (through [[addWaypoint]])
|p3= altitude: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 100) height at which air unit will spawn and fly above ground level
|p4= speedMode: [[String]] - (Optional, default "NORMAL") [[speedMode|speed mode]] at which air unit travels. Possible values are "LIMITED", "NORMAL" and "FULL"
|p5= classname: [[String]] - (Optional, default "B_Heli_Light_01_F") vehicle classname defined in [[CfgVehicles]]
|p6= side: [[Side]] - (Optional, default [[west]]) side to which the vehicle belongs
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if function executed successfully.
|x1= <sqf> // spawns a Littlebird that flies from position 200,200,50 to 250,250,75 at altitude 100 and normal speed [[200,200,50], [250,250,75]] call BIS_fnc_ambientFlyby; </sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[getPosATL player, getPosATL opforUnit, 400, "FULL", "B_Heli_Light_01_Armed_F", west] call BIS_fnc_ambientFlyby;</sqf>
|seealso= [[createVehicle]] [[BIS_fnc_spawnVehicle]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Ambient
|descr= Play set of ambient animations on given unit AND allows the unit to leave the ambient state and engage enemy or move away. {{Feature|informative|Animations can be cancelled using <sqf inline>_unit call BIS_fnc_ambientAnim__terminate</sqf>.}}
|s1= [unit, animationSet, equipmentLevel, condition, behaviour] call [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat]]
|p1= unit: [[Object]] - Unit where the animations will be played
|p2= animationSet: [[String]] - (Optional, default "STAND") The animation set to play. Possible values are: * "STAND" * "STAND_IA" * "SIT_LOW" * "KNEEL" * "LEAN" * "WATCH" * "WATCH1" * "WATCH2"
|p3= equipmentLevel: [[String]] - (Optional, default "RANDOM") The equipment level of the unit. Possible values are: * "NONE" * "LIGHT" * "MEDIUM" * "FULL" * "ASIS" * "RANDOM"
|p4= condition: [[Code]] or [[String]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>{ false }</sqf>) condition that if true frees the unit from the animation loop
|p5= behaviour: [[String]] - (Optional, default "COMBAT") behaviour the unit should go to, when freed. Default "COMBAT"
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[_unit, "STAND", "FULL", { (player distance _this) < 5 }] call BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnim]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Ambient
|descr= Feeds params of given animset to [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnim]].
|s1= animType call [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnimGetParams]]
|p1= animType: [[String]] - Can be: {{Columns|4| * "STAND1" * "STAND2" * "STAND_U1" * "STAND_U2" * "STAND_U3" * "WATCH" * "WATCH2" * "GUARD" * "LISTEN_BRIEFING" * "LEAN_ON_TABLE" * "LEAN" * "SIT_AT_TABLE" * "SIT1" * "SIT" * "SIT3" * "SIT_U1" * "SIT_U2" * "SIT_U3" * "SIT_HIGH1" * "SIT_HIGH" * "SIT_LOW" * "SIT_LOW_U" * "SIT_SAD1" * "SIT_SAD2" * "KNEEL" * "REPAIR_VEH_PRONE" * "REPAIR_VEH_KNEEL" * "REPAIR_VEH_STAND" * "PRONE_INJURED_U1" * "PRONE_INJURED_U2" * "PRONE_INJURED" * "KNEEL_TREAT" * "KNEEL_TREAT2" * "BRIEFING" * "BRIEFING_POINT_LEFT" * "BRIEFING_POINT_RIGHT" * "BRIEFING_POINT_TABLE" }}
|r1= [[Array]] - Animation parameters
|x1= <sqf>private _animParams = "KNEEL" call BIS_fnc_ambientAnimGetParams;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnimCombat]] [[BIS_fnc_ambientAnim]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Ambient
|descr= Animal behaviour control. Called by {{hl|Animals_F\Data\Scripts\main.fsm}}.
|s1= [animal] call [[BIS_fnc_animalBehaviour]]
|p1= animal: [[Object]] - The controlled animal
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[animal] call BIS_fnc_animalBehaviour;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma 3 Animals: Override Default Animal Behaviour Via Script | Animal Behaviour]] [[createAgent]] }}
<dl class="command_description">
<dt></dt> <dd class="notedate">Posted on September 29, 2014 - 19:38 (UTC)</dd> <dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt> <dd class="note">To override, add <sqf>_agent setVariable ["BIS_fnc_animalBehaviour_disable", true];</sqf> right after agent creation.</dd>
</dl>

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 0.58
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Sorts an array according to given algorithm. See [[sort]] for simple sorts.
|s1= [array, parameters, algorithm, direction, filter] call [[BIS_fnc_sortBy]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - any unsorted array. Can contain any types
|p2= parameters: [[Array]] * used in the eval algorithm * input params are referenced in the sorting algorithm by _input0..9 * a maximum of 10 input params is supported (0-9)
|p3= algorithm: [[Code]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>{ _x }</sqf>) * needs to return [[String]], [[Number]] or [[Array]] - see [[sort]] * [[Magic Variables#x|_x]] refers to array item
|p4= direction: [[String]] - (Optional, default "ASCEND") case-insensitive * "ASCEND" for ascending sorting * "DESCEND" (or anything else) for descending sorting
|p5= filter: [[Code]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>{ true }</sqf>) code that needs to evaluate true for the array item to be sorted, otherwise item is removed
|r1= [[Array]] - sorted array
|x1= <sqf> // sort numbers from lowest to highest _sortedNumbers = [[1,-80,0,480,15,-40], [], {_x}, "ASCEND"] call BIS_fnc_sortBy; </sqf>
|x2= <sqf> // sort helicopters by distance from player _closestHelicopters = [[_heli1,_heli2,_heli3], [], { player distance _x }, "ASCEND"] call BIS_fnc_sortBy; </sqf>
|x3= <sqf> // sort enemy by distance from friendly unit (referenced by local variable), the furthest first _furtherstEnemy = [[_enemy1,_enemy2,_enemy3], [_friendly], { _input0 distance _x }, "DESCEND", { canMove _x }] call BIS_fnc_sortBy; </sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_sortAlphabetically]] [[BIS_fnc_sortNum]] [[sort]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 0.58
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Return a new array with randomized order of elements from input array.
|s1= array call [[BIS_fnc_arrayShuffle]]
|p1= array: [[Array]]
|r1= [[Array]] - a new array instance
|x1= <sqf>[1,2,3] call BIS_fnc_arrayShuffle; // can return [1,2,3] (the original order), [3,1,2], [2,3,1], [1,3,2], [2,1,3] or [3,2,1]</sqf>
|seealso= [[sort]] [[BIS_fnc_sortBy]] [[random]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Respawn
|descr= Updates dead player objects to their current respawned objects.
|s1= [input] call [[BIS_fnc_updatePlayerArray]]
|p1= input: [[Array]] of [[Object]]s - Array of old player objects
|r1= [[Array]] - Array with new player objects
|x1= <sqf>private _newPlayerObjects = _oldPlayerObjects call BIS_fnc_updatePlayerArray;</sqf>
|seealso= [[player]] [[allPlayers]] [[playableUnits]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 0.76
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Finds duplicates in the given array of anything and consolidates them into an array of sub-arrays
|s1= array call [[BIS_fnc_consolidateArray]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - array of anything
|r1= [[Array]] - array of sub-arrays in format [<nowiki/>[value, count],...], where: * value: [[Anything]] - consolidated element * count: [[Number]] - occurrence count
|x1= <sqf>["apple","apple","pear","pear","apple"] call BIS_fnc_consolidateArray; // return: [["apple",3],["pear",2]]</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>["apple","apple",1,1,nil,nil] call BIS_fnc_consolidateArray; // return: [["apple",2],[1,2],[any,2]]</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 0.76
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Searches the associative array for the first occurance of the key string and returns its index. Seach is not case-sensitive.
|s1= [array, key] call [[BIS_fnc_findInPairs]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - Array to search through
|p2= key: [[String]] - Key to search for
|r1= [[Number]] - Index of first occurence
|x1= <sqf>[[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"apple"] call BIS_fnc_findInPairs; // Returns 0</sqf>
|seealso= [[find]] [[findIf]] [[BIS_fnc_getFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_setToPairs]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.02
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Searches the associative array for the 1st occurance of the key string and returns the value associated with it. Search is not case sensitiv.
|s1= [array, key, defaultValue] call [[BIS_fnc_getFromPairs]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - Array to search through
|p2= key: [[String]] - Key to search for
|p3= defaultValue: [[Anything]] - (Optional, default [[nil]]) Default return value if no match was found
|r1= [[Anything]] - Value associated with the key.
|x1= <sqf>[[["apple",3],["pear","test"]],"pear"] call BIS_fnc_getFromPairs; // Returns "test"</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[[["apple",3],["pear",6]],"pear"] call BIS_fnc_getFromPairs; // Returns "6"</sqf>
|seealso= [[find]] [[findIf]] [[BIS_fnc_findInPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_setToPairs]] }}
{{Note |user= Benargee |timestamp= 20141002011700 |text= [[BIS_fnc_findInPairs]] renamed to [[BIS_fnc_getFromPairs]] and now supports all variable types {{Link|http://dev.arma3.com/post/spotrep-00011|Source}} }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 0.76 |gr1= Arrays |descr= Adds given value to pair array, stored under unique key.

If value is found:
a) both values are scalars: values are added and stored as a single scalar
b) one or both values are array: values are added and stored as a single array
c) anything else: an array is created and both values are stored there

{{Feature|Informative|Function by default modifies the input array. This can be overrriden by setting '_copyArray' param to true.}} |s1= [array, key, value, copyArray] call [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] |p1= array: [[Array]] - Array to search through |p2= key: [[String]] - Key to search for |p3= value: [[Number]] - (Optional, default [[nil]]) Default return value if no match was found |p4= copyArray: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to copy the array and return it, [[false]] to modify the original array |r1= [[Array]] - Resulting modified array or a copy |x1= [[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"pear",10] call BIS_fnc_addToPairs; // Returns [["apple",3],["pear",12]] |x2= [[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"apple",-2] call BIS_fnc_addToPairs; // Returns [["apple",1],["pear",2]] |x3= [[["greetings","Hello!"],["rudewords",""]],"greetings","Hi!"] call BIS_fnc_addToPairs; // Returns [["greetings",["Hello!","Hi!"]],["rudewords",""]] |seealso= [[find]] [[findIf]] [[BIS_fnc_findInPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_getFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_setToPairs]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Removes an item from pair array modifying the original array. This can be overriden by setting ''_copyArray'' to true.
|s1= [array, key, copyArray] call [[BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - array to search through
|p2= key: [[String]] - key to search for
|p3= copyArray: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to copy the array and return it, [[false]] to modify the original array
|r1= [[Array]] - resulting modified array or a copy
|x1= <sqf>private _pairs = [[["apple", 3], ["pear", 2]], "pear"]; [_pairs, "pear", true] call BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs; // returns [["apple", 3]] - _pairs is not modified [_pairs, "pear"] call BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs; // returns [["apple", 3]] - _pairs is now [["apple", 3]] </sqf>
|seealso= [[find]] [[findIf]] [[BIS_fnc_findInPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_getFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_setToPairs]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Arrays
|descr= Works similar to the [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] but it doesn't try to add values. It just overwrites the volue if the key already exists.
|s1= [array, key, newValue] call [[BIS_fnc_setToPairs]]
|p1= array: [[Array]] - Array to search through
|p2= key: [[String]] - Key to search for
|p3= newValue: [[Anything]] - (Optional, default 1) New value set if match was found
|r1= [[Array]] - Resulting modified array
|x1= <sqf>[[["apple",3],["pear",2]],"pear",10] call BIS_fnc_setToPairs; // Returns [["apple",3],["pear",10]]</sqf>
|seealso= [[find]] [[findIf]] [[BIS_fnc_findInPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_getFromPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_addToPairs]] [[BIS_fnc_removeFromPairs]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.10
|gr1= Arrays
|gr2= Strings
|descr= Alphabetically sort an array of strings without modifying the original. See also [[sort]].
|s1= arrayOfStrings call [[BIS_fnc_sortAlphabetically]]
|p1= arrayOfStrings: [[Array]] of [[String]]s
|r1= [[Array]] of [[String|strings]] sorted alphabetically.
|x1= <sqf>private _sortedNames = ["John", "Jane", "Julia", "Geronimo"] call BIS_fnc_sortAlphabetically; // will return ["Geronimo", "Jane", "John", "Julia"]</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_sortBy]] [[BIS_fnc_sortNum]] [[sort]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.78
|gr1= Briefing
|descr= Initialize animated briefing markers.
|s1= marker call [[BIS_fnc_briefingInit]]
|p1= marker: [[String]] - Marker to initialise
|x1= "marker_1" [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_briefingInit]];
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_briefingAnimate]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Combat
|descr= Return list of nearby enemy targets for given unit.
|s1= unit call [[BIS_fnc_enemyTargets]]
|p1= unit - [[Object]]: unit that is inspected
|r1= [[Array]] of enemies, empty if unit doesn't know about any enemy
|x1= <sqf>private _targets = _unit call BIS_fnc_enemyTargets;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_enemyDetected]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Combat
|descr= Returns true if unit knows about nearby enemy unit or driven vehicle.
|s1= unit call [[BIS_fnc_enemyDetected]]
|p1= unit - [[Object]]: unit that is inspected
|r1= [[Boolean]]: True if an enemy was detected
|x1= <sqf>private _enemyDetected = _unit call BIS_fnc_enemyDetected;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_enemyTargets]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Returns config path to given entry in given format.
|s1= [config, format, strict] call [[BIS_fnc_configPath]]
|p1= config: [[Array]], [[String]] or [[Config]] - input config
|p2= format: [[Array]], [[String]] or [[Config]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>[]</sqf> or <sqf inline>configNull</sqf> if ''config'' is [[Array]] - see {{Link|#Example 1}}) desired format of output
|p3= strict: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) if false, the function will not attempt to construct a valid config before certain format conversions (see {{Link|#Example 2}}). Set this param to [[true]] to invoke the strict mode
|r1= [[Array]], [[String]] or [[Config]]
|x1= <sqf>["configFile >> ""CfgVehicles"" >> ""Car"""] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // ["configFile","CfgVehicles","Car"]</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[["mary", "had", "a", "little", "lamb"], ""] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // "mary >> ""had"" >> ""a"" >> ""little"" >> ""lamb"""</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>[["configFile","CfgVehicles","Car"]] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car</sqf>
|x4= <sqf>["bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car"] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // ["configFile","CfgVehicles","Car"]</sqf>
|x5= <sqf>[configFile >> "CfgVehicles" >> "Car", ""] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // "configFile >> ""CfgVehicles"" >> ""Car"""</sqf>
|x6= <sqf>["bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car", "", true] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // "configFile >> ""CfgVehicles"" >> ""Car"""</sqf>
|x7= <sqf>["bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car", ""] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // "bin\config.cpp/CfgVehicles/Car"</sqf>
|x8= <sqf>[["mary", "had", "a", "little", "lamb"], "", true] call BIS_fnc_configPath; // "" invalid config</sqf>
|seealso= [[configHierarchy]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= ''Same function as [[BIS_fnc_returnChildren]]''
|s1= <!-- [] call [[BIS_fnc_subClasses]] -->
|r1=
|x1= <!-- <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_subClasses;</sqf> -->
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Configs |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Composes array of classes with unique param (based on returned value of passed code).
	If class inherits the param from parent, it is not listed.
	
	Parameter(s):
		0: CONFIG - class which is searched
		1: CODE - code executed on class, which is passed as _this
	
	Returns:
		ARRAY - classes in format [class,value]
			class: CONFIG - class with unique param
			value: ANY - value returned by the passed code for the given class
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}}|s1= |p1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Searches for class in mission, campaign and then in global config file.
|s1= [input, defaultValue] call [[BIS_fnc_loadClass]]
|p1= '''input''': [[Array]] of [[String]]s - Containing [[Config|config]] paths
|p2= '''defaultValue''': [[Config]] - Default [[Config|config]] used if '''input''' cannot be found
|r1= [[Config]]
|x1= <sqf>[ ["bin\config.bin"], configFile >> "Cfg3DEN" >> "Camera"] call BIS_fnc_loadClass</sqf>
|seealso= [[configFile]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Searches for config entry in mission, campaign and then in global config file.
|s1= [path,defaultConfig] call [[BIS_fnc_loadEntry]]
|p1= path: [[Array]] of [[String|strings]] - Path
|p2= defaultConfig: [[Config]] - Default path used in case when the original one is not found
|r1= [[Array]], [[Number]] or [[String]]
|x1= <sqf>[ ["CfgWeapons","hgun_Rook40_snds_F","bullet3"], configfile >> "CfgWeapons" >> "hgun_Rook40_snds_F" >> "baseWeapon" ] call BIS_fnc_loadEntry;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_loadClass]] [[configFile]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Return addon from CfgPatches to which a given object belongs to.
|s1= [object] call [[BIS_fnc_unitAddon]]
|p1= object: [[Object]] - Object whose addon should be returned
|r1= [[String]] - addon class
|x1= <sqf>[ player ] call BIS_fnc_unitAddon;</sqf>
|seealso= [[unitAddons]] [[activatedAddons]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Return true if it is a class. Can by called in two ways: * first way (general) works for any config * second way is for comfortable working with mission description.ext
|s1= configEntry call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgIsClass]]
|p1= configEntry: [[Config]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if it is a class
|s2= classNames call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgIsClass]]
|p21= classNames: [[Array]] of [[String]] - [[missionConfigFile]] classes and an attribute
|r2= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if it is a class
|x1= <sqf>private _isClass = (missionConfigFile >> "Hubs" >> "A1" >> "QuickStart") call BIS_fnc_getCfgIsClass;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>private _isClass = ["Hubs"] call BIS_fnc_getCfgIsClass;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_getCfg]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataPool]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgSubClasses]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Configs |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Return all child classes of given class.

	Remark(s):
	* Can by called 2 ways:
		* 1st way (general) works for any config.
		* 2nd way is for comfortable working with mission description.ext.

	Parameter(s):
		_this: CFG
		_this: ARRAY of STRINGS - missionConfigFile classes and an attribute.

	Example:

	* 1st way of calling:

		_subclasses = (missionconfigfile >> "Hubs" >> "A1" >> "QuickStart") call Bis_fnc_getCfgSubClasses;

	* 2nd way of calling:

		_subclasses = ["Hubs"] call Bis_fnc_getCfgSubClasses;

	Returns:
		ARRAY (of STRINGS with sub-classes names)
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= private _allVehHitPoints = (configfile >> "CfgVehicles" >> "C_Hatchback_01_sport_F" >> "HitPoints") call BIS_fnc_getCfgSubClasses; |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Configs |descr= Gets an array defined in Config. If the value is not an array, it is retyped into one.

- Default syntax works for any config.
- Alternative syntax is for comfortable working with mission [[Description.ext|description.ext]]. |s1= config call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]] |p1= config: [[Config]] - [[Config]] path |r1= [[Array]] or [[nil]] |s2= array call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]] |p21= [[Array]] of [[Strings]] - [[missionConfigFile]] classes and an attribute |r2= [[Array]] or [[nil]] |x1= private _array = (missionConfigFile >> "Characters" >> "Default" >> "equipAdjust") call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray; |x2= private _array = ["Characters","Default","equipAdjust"] call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataPool]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Configs |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Get the object defined in cfg by its name (global variable).

	Remark(s):
	* Can by called 2 ways:
		* 1st way (general) works for any config.
		* 2nd way is for comfortable working with mission description.ext.

	Parameter(s):
		_this: CFG
		_this: ARRAY of STRINGS - missionConfigFile classes and an attribute.

	Example:

	* 1st way of calling:

		_value = (missionconfigfile >> "Hubs" >> "A1" >> "QuickStart" >> "trigger") call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject;

	* 2nd way of calling:

		_value = ["Hubs","A1","QuickStart","trigger"] call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject;

	Returns:
		OBJECT or OBJNULL
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Gets a number defined in config and retype it into a boolean. Everything greater than 0 is [[true]], otherwise it is [[false]]. * Default syntax works for any config * Alternative syntax is for comfortable working with mission's [[Description.ext]].
|s1= config call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]]
|p1= config: [[Config]] - [[Config]] path
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|s2= array call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]]
|p21= [[Array]] of [[Strings]] - [[missionConfigFile]] classes and an attribute
|r2= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>private _value = (missionConfigFile >> "Characters" >> "Default" >> "equipAdjust") call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>private _value = ["Characters", "Default", "equipAdjust"] call BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataPool]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Configs |descr= Smart-return number, text or array value from config.

- Default syntax works for any config.
- Alternative syntax is for comfortable working with mission [[Description.ext|description.ext]]. |s1= config call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] |p1= config: [[Config]] - [[Config]] path |r1= [[Array]], [[String]], [[Number]] or [[nil]] |s2= array call [[BIS_fnc_getCfgData]] |p21= [[Array]] of [[Strings]] - [[missionConfigFile]] classes and an attribute |r2= [[Array]], [[String]], [[Number]] or [[nil]] |x1= private _value = (configFile >> "BulletBubbles" >> "BulletBubbles1" >> "type") call BIS_fnc_getCfgData; |x2= private _value = (missionConfigFile >> "Hubs" >> "A1" >> "QuickStart" >> "trigger") call BIS_fnc_getCfgData; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataArray]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataObject]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataPool]] [[BIS_fnc_getCfgDataBool]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Returns function's meta data.
|s1= functionName call [[BIS_fnc_functionMeta]]
|p1= functionName: [[String]] - (Optional, default parent function's name) function name, e.g., "[[BIS_fnc_stalk]]"
|r1= [[Array]] to format [fileLocation, extension, headerType, preInit, postInit, recompile, game, category, name]: * fileLocation: [[String]] * extension: [[String]] - to format ".extension", e.g ".sqf", ".fsm" * headerType: [[Number]] - one of: ** 0: No Debug - header saves parent script name and current script name into variables ** 1: Save script Map - header additionaly save an array of all parent scripts into variable ** 2: Save and log script map - apart from saving into variable, script map is also logged through debugLog * preInit: [[Boolean]] * postInit: [[Boolean]] * recompile: [[Boolean]] * game: [[String]] * category: [[String]] * name: [[String]] - simple name, without TAG_fnc
|x1= <sqf>// returns ["A3\functions_f\Debug\fn_functionMeta.sqf", ".sqf", 0, false, false, false, "A3", "Debug", "functionMeta"] "BIS_fnc_functionMeta" call BIS_fnc_functionMeta;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>// returns ["", "", 0, false, false, false, "", "", ""] "unknownFunction" call BIS_fnc_functionMeta;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Debug | Debug Functions]] [[BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Splendidâ„¢ Camera, ''"Ultimate Screenshot Simulator"''
|s1= [mode, parameter] call [[BIS_fnc_camera]]
|p1= mode: [[String]] - (Optional, default "Init") '''case-sensitive''', for internal use. Can be one of: {{Columns|4| * "Init" * "Mouse" * "MouseButtonDown" * "MouseButtonUp" * "MouseZChanged" * "KeyDown" * "KeyUp" * "Draw3D" * "MapDraw" * "MapClick" * "SliderFocus" * "SliderAperture" * "SliderDaytime" * "SliderOvercast" * "SliderAcctime" * "SliderColor" * "SliderContrast" * "SliderSaturation" * "Paste" * "InitDummy" * "ExitDummy" * "Exit" }}
|p2= parameter: [[Anything]] - (Optional, default [])
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_camera;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[] spawn BIS_fnc_camera;</sqf>
|x3= <sqf>["Init"] call BIS_fnc_camera;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Camera.sqs]] [[Arma 3: Splendid Camera|Splendid camera controls]] [[BIS_fnc_cameraOld]] }}
<dl class="command_description">
<dt></dt> <dd class="notedate">Posted on October 10, 2014 - 00:15 (UTC)</dd> <dt class="note">[[User:Benargee|Benargee]]</dt> <dd class="note">(Arma 3 1.30) Calling from pause menu debug console without arguments will crash the game. Tested in singleplayer editor preview.</dd>
</dl>

revision.comment: Text replacement - "[[Script Handle|Script handle]]" to "[[Script Handle]]"
revision.text:
{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Classic camera script, replaced by the Splendidâ„¢ [[BIS_fnc_camera]].
|s1= [target] call [[BIS_fnc_cameraOld]]
|p1= target: [[Object]] - (Optional, default [[cameraOn]])
|r1= [[Script Handle]]
|x1= <sqf>[player] call BIS_fnc_cameraOld; // starts the camera on the player</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_camera]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Returns true when game version is demo.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_isDemo]]
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>private _isDemo = call BIS_fnc_isDemo;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_version]] [[productVersion]] [[requiredVersion]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Opens the [[Arma 3: Splendid Animation Viewer|Splendid™ Animation Viewer]].
|s1= [] call [[BIS_fnc_animViewer]]
<!-- p0= arrayFromHeader: [[Array]] - forced animation in format [<unit class>, <animation class>]
|p1= mode: [[String]] - (Optional, default "Init")
|p2= arguments: [[Array]] - (Optional, default []) --> |r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_animViewer;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_configViewer]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Start automatic loading screen upon mission start. On client, it will finish only when server is finished.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_preload]]
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_preload;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

revision.comment: Text replacement - "[[Script Handle|Script handle]]" to "[[Script Handle]]"
revision.text:
{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= Fill an '''AAR''' (After Action Review) display with data and Event Handlers.
{{Feature|important| [[BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord]] '''must''' have been previously executed to have data to display.}} |s1= [mode, arguments] call [[BIS_fnc_diagAAR]] |p1= mode: [[String]] - can be one of: * "Init" - Fill display with AAR data * "Init_List" - ''internal function usage'' * "Display_keydown" - ''internal function usage'' * "Timeline_sliderposchanged" - ''internal function usage'' * "ListMissions_lbselchanged" - ''internal function usage'' * "ListSessions_lbselchanged" - ''internal function usage'' * "draw" - ''internal function usage'' |p2= arguments: * "Init" arguments: [display]: [[Display]] * "Init_List" arguments: [display]: [[Display]] * "Display_keydown" arguments: see [[User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onKeyDown|onKeyDown]] event * "Timeline_sliderposchanged" arguments: see [[User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onSliderPosChanged|onSliderPosChanged]] event * "ListMissions_lbselchanged" arguments: see [[User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onLbSelChanged|onLBSelChanged]] event * "ListSessions_lbselchanged" arguments: see [[User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onLbSelChanged|onLBSelChanged]] event * "draw" arguments: see [[User_Interface_Event_Handlers#onDraw|onDraw]] event |r1= [[Script Handle]] |x1= ["Init", [_anAARDisplay]] call BIS_fnc_diagAAR; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= Starts recording units position and events for an '''AAR''' (After Action Review).
The following keys must be added to [[Description.ext]] for AAR to work properly: diagAAR = 1; // to enable diag AAR diagAARauthor = 1; // if description.ext/dev == profileName, allows the creator to debug himself diagAARunits = 2; // which units to record: // 1 = units player // 2 = allunits + alldead // any other value = player diagAARdelay = 3; // delay between recording steps The data can be accessed with profileNamespace getVariable "BIS_fnc_diagAAR_data". |s1= call [[BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord]] |r1= [[Number]] - the FSM handle (see [[execFSM]]) |x1= call BIS_fnc_diagAARrecord; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_diagAAR]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Tracks received wounds. ([[getNumber]] ([[missionConfigFile]] >> "diagHit") > 0) has to be [[true]].
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_diagHit]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when activated
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagHit;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Tracks pressed keys. ([[getNumber]] ([[missionConfigFile]] >> "diagKey") > 0) has to be [[true]].
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_diagKey]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when activated
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagKey;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Radio
|gr2= Diagnostic
|descr= Tracks played radio sentences.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_diagRadio]]
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagRadio;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Lists all weapons and magazines available in a mission.
|s1= [clipboard] call [[BIS_fnc_diagMissionWeapons]]
|p1= clipboard: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) - [[true]] to copy list to clipboard
|r1= [[Array]] - List of weapons available in mission
|x1= <sqf>true call BIS_fnc_diagMissionWeapons;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Displays positions of units from all missions
|s1= [configPath, allUnits, isCampaign] call [[BIS_fnc_diagMissionPositions]]
|p1= configPath: [[Config]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>configFile >> "CfgMissions"</sqf>)
|p2= allUnits: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to display all units, [[false]] to display only player positions
|p3= isCampaign: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] for the scan to perceive the main folder as campaign (required when ''configPath'' is direct path to campaign)
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= <sqf>[configFile >> "CfgMissions", true, false] call BIS_fnc_diagMissionPositions;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diagnostic Function Group]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Previews selected classes from given container.
|s1= [container, parentClass, distance, startPos] call [[BIS_fnc_diagPreview]]
|p1= container: [[String]] - (Optional, default "CfgVehicles") - Class container. Can be: *"CfgVehicles" *"CfgWeapons" |p2= parentClass: [[String]] - (Optional, default [[typeOf]] [[player]]) - Parent class of the objects (e.g. "Car" or "Rifle") |p3= distance: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 10) - Distance between objects |p4= startPos: [[Position]] - (Optional, default [[screenToWorld]] [0.5,0.5] in [[Eden Editor]] or [[position]] [[player]]) - Start position
|r1= [[Array]] - List of created classes
|x1= <sqf>[ "CfgVehicles", "Car", 15, [0,0,0] ] call BIS_fnc_diagPreview;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Creates vehicles with their crew.
|s1= [class, numVeh, distance] call [[BIS_fnc_diagPreviewVehicleCrew]]
|p1= class: [[String]] - Vehicle class name |p2= numVeh: [[Array]] - Number of vehicles in format: *0: rows *1: columns **Number of vehicles: #rows * #columns |p3= Distance: [[Number]] - Distance between vehicles
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>["B_MRAP_01_F", [5,5], 10] call BIS_fnc_diagPreviewVehicleCrew;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Previews selected class from the list. When '''cheat1''' is activated, classnames will be shown instead of display names.
|s1= [container, position, vector, display] call [[BIS_fnc_diagPreviewCycle]]
|p1= container: [[String]] - (Optional, default "CfgVehicles") - Class container. Can be: *"CfgVehicles" *"CfgWeapons" |p2= position: [[Position]] - (Optional, [[position]] [[player]]) - Position of the previewed object |p3= vector [[Array]] - (Optional, default [0,0]]) - Vector of previewed object in format: *0: Pitch *1: Bank |p4= display: [[Display]] - (Optional, default [[BIS_fnc_displayMission]]) - Parent display
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>[ "CfgVehicles"] call BIS_fnc_diagPreviewCycle;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= Returns all user actions according to mode. |s1= mode call [[BIS_fnc_diagKeyTest]] |p1=mode: [[Number]] - Can be:
0 - Log all categories
1 - Log Uncategorized
2 - Log unassigned
3 - Log undefined
4 - Log localized names |r1= [[String]] |x1= 0 call BIS_fnc_diagKeyTest; |seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diagnostic Functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Scans specific config folder and outputs the values in wiki format.
|s1= [mode] call [[BIS_fnc_diagWiki]]
|p1= mode: [[String]] - Can be one of: {{{!}} style{{=}}"width: 100%" {{!}}"Anims_aimPrecision" {{!}}"CfgDiary_Icons" {{!}}"CfgActions" {{!}}"CfgActions_CfgVehicles" {{!}}- {{!}}"CfgLocationTypes" {{!}}"CfgMarkers" {{!}}"CfgMarkerBrushes" {{!}}"CfgMarkerColors" {{!}}- {{!}}"CfgVehicles_identityTypes" {{!}}"CfgVehicles_mapSize" {{!}}"CfgVehicles_speechVariants" {{!}}"CfgVehicleIcons" {{!}}- {{!}}"CfgWrapperUI_Cursors" {{!}}"IslandMap_colors" {{!}}"IslandMap_icons" {{!}}"RadioProtocol_Select" {{!}}- {{!}}"RadioProtocol_Sent" {{!}}"RadioProtocol_Stats" {{!}}"RadioProtocol_Variables" {{!}}"RadioProtocol_Words" {{!}}- {{!}}"RscMapControl_colors" {{!}}"RscMapControl_icons" {{!}}"RscMapControl_fonts" {{!}}}
|r1= [[String]] - Data in wiki format
|x1= <sqf>["RadioProtocol_Sent"] call BIS_fnc_diagWiki;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|gr2= Broken Functions
|descr= Previews all vehicle icons on map. {{Feature|Warning|This function is broken as it uses bad arguments for [[BIS_fnc_returnParents]] ('''line 35''', {{hl|""}} instead of {{hl|true}})}}
|s1= [parentClass, position, map] call [[BIS_fnc_diagVehicleIcons]]
|p1= parentClass: [[String]] - (Optional, default "all")
|p2= position: [[Position]] - (Optional, default [100,100]) position of the first icon on the ''map'', others will be layered on top of it
|p3= map: [[Control]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>findDisplay 12 displayCtrl 51</sqf> a.k.a main map)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>["all", getPos player] call BIS_fnc_diagVehicleIcons;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Prints config entries.

	Parameter(s):
		0: CONFIG - config class which will be searched (default: configFile)
		1: STRING or ARRAY - entry name(s) whose values will be printed
		2: STRING - scan mode, can be one of following:
			"controls" - recursively scans controls in root, class controls, class controlsBackground and in RscControlsGroup controls (type = 15).
			"turrets" - recursively scans vehicles's turrets.
			"weapons" - scans weapon muzzles and modes.
			(default) - scans just class roots.

	Returns:
	STRING

	Results are printed to debug log and wiki compatible table is copied to clipboard.
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Runs scripted loop. Repeated call terminates previous loops.
|s1= [code,delay] spawn [[BIS_fnc_diagLoop]]
|p1= code: [[Code]] - Code to be executed |p2= code: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0.1) Delay between loops
|exec= spawn
|r1= [[Script]] - [[spawn|Spawn]] handle
|x1= <sqf>[{systemChat "Loop!"}, 0.5] spawn BIS_fnc_diagLoop;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= Shows a utility tool checking length of weapon info texts.
[[File:BIS_fnc_locWeaponInfo screenshot.png|500px]] |s1= call [[BIS_fnc_locWeaponInfo]] |r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done |x1= call BIS_fnc_locWeaponInfo; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_animViewer]] [[BIS_fnc_configViewer]] [[BIS_fnc_help]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Visualize and profile which units one specific unit knows about and how much. Calling function again stops diagnostics.
|s1= [target, radius] call [[BIS_fnc_diagKnownTargets]]
|p1= target: [[Object]] - (Optional, default [[player]]) - Profiled unit |p2= radius: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 3000) - Radius of the scanned area
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagKnownTargets;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= 
/*
	File: fn_diagKnownAsTarget.sqf

	Description:
	Visualize and profile which units know about one specific unit and how much they do.
	Calling function again stops diagnostics.
	
	Parameter(s):
	_this select 0: profile unit (Object) [default player]
	_this select 1: radius (Scalar - meters) [default 1000m]
	
	Returns:
	-
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Exports config macros.

	Parameter(s):
		0: CONFIG or ARRAY - config container to be searched (e.g. configFile >> "CfgVehicles") or list of classes or classnames
		1: ARRAY - list of macro names to be used (e.g. ["MAPSIZE","NAMESOUND"])
		2 (Optional): STRING - macro category name (when param 0 is CONFIG, its classname is used by default - e.g. "CfgVehicles")

	Returns:
	STRING
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= ''N/A''
|s1= <!-- [] call [[BIS_fnc_diagMacrosVerify]] -->
|r1=
|x1= <!-- <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_diagMacrosVerify;</sqf> -->
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= 
/*

	Description:
	Prints mapSize values based on real object size and copies it to clipboard.
	Mission has to be running on order to get the values.

	Parameter(s):
		0: CONFIG or ARRAY - either config container, or list of classes or classnames
		1: STRING - output mode, can be on of following:
			"wiki" - wiki table
			"config" - #define macros with model dimension values
			"config_current" - #define macros with current config values
		2: ARRAY - list of classnames which will be excluded from the scan

	Returns:
	STRING
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Detects vehicle types and prints their radio protocol definitions to clipboard.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_diagMacrosNameSound]]
|r1= [[String]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagMacrosNameSound;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= ''N/A''
|s1= <!-- [] call [[BIS_fnc_diagMacrosAuthor]] -->
|r1=
|x1= <!-- <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_diagMacrosAuthor;</sqf> -->
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Copies a list of objects to the clipboard which miss the author attribute.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_diagFindMissingAuthors]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_diagFindMissingAuthors;</sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diag functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= ''N/A''
|s1= <!-- [] call [[BIS_fnc_exportGroupFormations]] -->
|r1=
|x1= <!-- <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_exportGroupFormations;</sqf> -->
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Export list of weapons for Community Wiki [[:Category:Arma 3: Assets|Arma 3 Assets Category]].
|s1= [mode, patches, types] spawn [[BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons]]
|p1= mode: [[String]] - can be one of: * "Equipment" * "Item" * "VehicleWeapon" * "Weapon" - specific item type, based on [[BIS_fnc_itemType]] * internal use only: "screenshots" - create items one by one and take their screenshot. Works only on "Render" terrain. * internal use only: "screenshotsTest" - create items one by one without taking screen (to verify everything is ok)
|p2= patches: [[Array]] of [[String]]s - (Optional, default <sqf inline>[]</sqf>) list of [[CfgPatches]] classes. Only weapons belonging to these addons will be used
|p3= types: [[Array]] of [[String]]s - (Optional, default <sqf inline>[]</sqf>)
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= export [[Arma 3: CfgWeapons Weapons]], [[Arma 3: CfgWeapons Vehicle Weapons]], [[Arma 3: CfgWeapons Items]], [[Arma 3: CfgWeapons Equipment]], screenshots: <sqf> ["Weapon"] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons; // Arma 3: CfgWeapons Weapons ["VehicleWeapon"] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons; // Arma 3: CfgWeapons Vehicle Weapons ["Item"] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons; // Arma 3: CfgWeapons Items ["Equipment"] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons; // Arma 3: CfgWeapons Equipment ["screenshots"] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons; // screenshots ["screenshotsTest"] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons; // screenshots test mode, does nothing </sqf>
|seealso= [[:Category:Function Group: Diagnostic|Diagnostic Function Group]]
|exec= spawn }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|exec= spawn
|descr= Export list of magazines for [[:Category:Arma 3: Assets|Arma 3: Assets]].
|s1= [classes] spawn [[BIS_fnc_exportCfgMagazines]]
|p1= classes: [[Array]] of [[String]]s - (Optional, default <sqf inline>[]</sqf>) list of [[CfgPatches]] classes
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= exports [[Arma 3: CfgMagazines]]: <sqf>[] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgMagazines;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[["class1", "class2"]] spawn BIS_fnc_exportCfgMagazines;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Export list of addons for Community Wiki - [[:Category:Arma 3: Assets|Arma 3: Assets]].
|s1= [config, classes] call [[BIS_fnc_exportCfgPatches]]
|p1= config: [[String]] - (Optional, default "CfgVehicles")
|p2= classes: [[Array]] of [[String|strings]] - List of CfgPatches classes
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_exportCfgPatches;</sqf>
|x2= export [[Arma 3: CfgPatches CfgVehicles]] and [[Arma 3: CfgPatches CfgWeapons]]: <sqf> ["CfgVehicles"] call BIS_fnc_exportCfgPatches; // Arma 3: CfgPatches CfgVehicles ["CfgWeapons"] call BIS_fnc_exportCfgPatches; // Arma 3: CfgPatches CfgWeapons </sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki]] [[BIS_fnc_exportCfgWeapons]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Exports {{hl|CfgHints}} to wiki format (see [[:Category:Arma 3: Field Manual]]).
|s1= [category, class] call [[BIS_fnc_exportCfgHints]]
|p1= category: [[String]]
|p2= class: [[String]]
|r1= [[String]] - wiki content
|x1= <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_exportCfgHints;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_exportEditorPreviews]] [[BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.08
|gr1= Diagnostic
|descr= Imports CfgVehicles image links from Community Wiki (https://community.bistudio.com/). # Run the script. It will copy a text into clipboard # Open your [[Special:MyPage/Sandbox|Sandbox]] and paste the text into edit field # '''Preview''' the page (don't save it) # Copy the resulting text and use it in your scripts
Result is to the following format: <sqf> _imagesCfgVehicles = [ "papercar","https://community.bistudio.com/wikidata/images/8/85/Arma3_CfgVehicles_PaperCar.jpg", "firesectortarget","", "building","", // etc ]; </sqf>
{{Feature|important|Be wary that this function is '''CPU-demanding''' and may lock your computer for 5-10 seconds!}}
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_importImageLinks]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] when done
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_importImageLinks;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Special:Upload|Upload a File on the Wiki]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Diagnostic |descr= Export function descriptions to Community Wiki. Exported text will be copied to clipboard in XML format.
'''Wiki Admins''' can import them using '''[[Special:Import]]'''.
If the page already exists, it will be replaced only when ''timestamp'' is newer. {{Feature|Warning|
This function should no longer be used to mass-import functions since the template for function pages has changed drastically!
}} |s1= [filter, timestamp] spawn [[BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki]] |p1= filter: [[Array]] - (Optional, default []) functions filter in format [tags, categories, functions]: * tags: [[String]] or [[Array]] of [[String]]s - CfgFunctions tags (e.g., "A3_Oldman"). Use empty string for all of them * categories: [[String]] or [[Array]] of [[String]]s - categories (e.g., "Debug"). Use empty string for all of them * functions: [[String]] or [[Array]] of [[String]]s - specific function names (e.g., "BIS_fnc_log"). Use empty string for all of them |p2= timestamp: [[String]] - (Optional, default "2006-04-03T17:42:00Z") in format "2013-09-12T16:00:00Z" |r1= [[String]] - exported text |x1= [] spawn BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki; // export all functions |x2= [["", "Arrays"]] spawn BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki; // export all Array functions |x3= [["", "", ["BIS_fnc_log", "BIS_fnc_param"]]] spawn BIS_fnc_exportFunctionsToWiki; // export specific functions |exec= spawn |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_diagWiki]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Systems |descr= Apply post-process effects according to template from [[Description.ext#CfgPostprocessTemplates|CfgPostprocessTemplates]]. |s1= [template, transition, global] call [[BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate]] |p1= template: [[String]] - (Optional, default "Default") the template name. An invalid value will fall back to "Default".
Available game templates are: * "Default" * "BlackAndWhite" * "Mediterranean" * "EastWind" * "RealIsBrown" |p2= transition: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) time to apply the post-process |p3= global: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[isMultiplayer]]) should the post-process be broadcast over the network |r1= [[Boolean]] - true when done |x1= ["Mediterranean", 3, false] call BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate; |x2= "RealIsBrown" call BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate; |x3= "MyPurplePP" call BIS_fnc_setPPeffectTemplate; // can use a template defined in Description.ext |seealso= [[Post Process Effects]] [[ppEffectCreate]] [[ppEffectForceInNVG]] [[ppEffectEnable]] [[ppEffectEnabled]] [[ppEffectDestroy]] [[ppEffectCommit]] [[ppEffectCommitted]] [[ppEffectAdjust]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Main feedback [[FSM]], used for feedback effects (fatigue, drowning, injury etc.). Internal use only.
|s1= [] call [[BIS_fnc_feedbackMain]]
|p1=
|r1= [[Number]]? ([[execFSM]])
|x1= <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_feedbackMain;</sqf>
|seealso= [[FSM]] [[:Category:Function Group: Feedback|Feedback Function Group]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Adds the bleeding effect post-processing effect to the players screen.
|s1= [10] call [[BIS_fnc_bloodEffect]]
|p1= [[Number]] - Duration in (milli?)seconds in which effect should be visible.
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[10] call BIS_fnc_bloodEffect; // Adds the blood effect for 10 (milli)seconds.</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_indicateBleeding]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback

|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_damageChanged]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_damageChanged;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_incapacitatedEffect]] [[BIS_fnc_healing]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|eff= local
|descr= Screen dirt (texture) postprocess. Displays dust PP according to damage obtained from near explosion; takes array from "Explosion" event handler.
|s1= [unit, damage] call [[BIS_fnc_dirtEffect]]
|p1= unit: [[Object]] - who gets the damage. '''Unused and useless parameter'''
|p2= damage: [[Number]] - damage given to unit by explosion
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[nil, 0.5] call BIS_fnc_dirtEffect;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_bloodEffect]] [[BIS_fnc_flamesEffect]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Effects for high fatigue values. Internal engine use only, as it relies on internal BIS_* variables.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_fatigueEffect]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_fatigueEffect;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

revision.comment: Text replacement - "[[Post process effects]]" to "[[Post Process Effects]]"
revision.text:
{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Init function for feedback system. Declaration of variables, eventhandlers, etc. for in-game effects. Engine use only.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_feedbackInit]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_feedbackInit;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Post Process Effects]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Flames (texture) postprocess.
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_flamesEffect]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_flamesEffect;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_dirtEffect]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Broken Functions
|gr2= Feedback
|descr= Healing postprocess. Supposed to give healing postprocess effects. {{Feature|Warning|This function is unfinished, must not and '''cannot''' be used!}}
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_healing]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_healing; // do NOT use</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_healthEffects]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Broken Functions
|gr2= Feedback
|descr= A draft of incapacitated effects function. {{Feature|Warning|Does nothing, as the whole code is commented out.}}
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_incapacitatedEffect]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_incapacitatedEffect;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_damageChanged]] [[BIS_fnc_healthEffects]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Red radial postprocess (hit damage, fire damage). Parameters are the same as the first four of [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HandleDamage|HandleDamage EH]].
|s1= [victim, bodyPart, damage, shooter] call [[BIS_fnc_radialRed]]
|p1= victim: [[Object]] - unit who gets damage
|p2= bodyPart: [[String]] - body part which gets damage
|p3= damage: [[Number]] - received damage amount
|p4= shooter: [[Object]] - (Optional, default objNull) requested only if ''bodyPart'' is not empty string
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>player addEventHandler ["HandleDamage", { _this call BIS_fnc_radialRed; }];</sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma_3:_Event_Handlers#HandleDamage|HandleDamage EH]] [[BIS_fnc_radialRedOut]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Feedback
|descr= Removes red radial postprocess (fire damage) created by [[BIS_fnc_radialRed]].
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_radialRedOut]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_radialRedOut;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_radialRed]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Geometry
|descr= Exponentially inflated rational number between 0 and 1, with 1 being center and 0 being edge of the trigger. This function can be used to check where in a trigger area an object is. Is it near the border of the trigger area the number will go against 0.
|s1= [referenceObject, relativeObject] call [[BIS_fnc_relScaledDist]]
|p1= referenceObject: [[Object]]
|p2= relativeObject: [[Object]]
|r1= [[Number]]
|x1= <sqf>[ myTrigger, player ] call BIS_fnc_relScaledDist;</sqf>
|seealso= [[distance]] [[distanceSqr]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Geometry
|descr= Returns the gradient angle (in radians) of the terrain at a specified position and a compass direction. It is an angle of the slope of a tangent plane to the terrain at the specified position in the specified direction.
|s1= <!-- [object, direction, delta] call [[BIS_fnc_terrainGradAngle]]; -->
|p1= object: [[Object]] or [[Position]]
|p2= direction: [[Number]] - direction where should be gradient calculated (compass direction)
|p3= delta: [[Number]] - which stepsize should be used
|r1= [[Number]] - gradient angle in radians
|x1= <sqf>private _radGrad = [getPos player, getDir player] call BIS_fnc_terrainGradAngle;</sqf>
|seealso= [[getDir]] [[surfaceNormal]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Geometry
|descr= Detects whether a position is within a square area of given size about center.
|s1= [center, size, position ] call [[BIS_fnc_isInsideArea]]
|p1= center: [[Array]] - Center [[Position]] of area to check |p2= size: [[Array]] - [x,y] offsets from center
|p3= position: [[Array]] - [[Position]] to check
|r1= [[Boolean]] - true when position is in area, false otherwise
|x1= <sqf>// Check an area, centered on the player that is 10m wide and 10m tall _size = [5, 5]; _checkPos = getPos player; _inArea = [_checkPos, _size, _checkPos] call BIS_fnc_isInsideArea;</sqf>
|seealso= [[createTrigger]] [[createMarker]] [[setTriggerArea]] [[setMarkerSize]] [[triggerArea]] [[markerSize]] [[BIS_fnc_inAngleSector]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Positions
|gr2= Geometry
|descr= Place an object relative to another object, like a ''setRelPos'' command.
|s1= [parent, child, relPos, direction] call [[BIS_fnc_relPosObject]]
|p1= parent: [[Object]] - the parent object
|p2= child: [[Object]] - the child object
|p3= relPos: [[Position]] - ''child'' position relative to ''parent''
|p4= direction: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) direction of the child object
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[BIS_briefingTable, BIS_map, [0, -0.58, 0.857], 98] call BIS_fnc_relPosObject;</sqf>
|seealso= [[getRelPos]] [[getPos]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= GUI
|eff= local
|descr= Displays Group Indicator (to the right of the screen in {{GVI|arma3|1.82}})
|s1= argument call [[BIS_fnc_groupIndicator]]
|p1= argument: [[Array]] - '''case-sensitive''', can be: * [] - displays Group Indicator * ["Exit"] - closes Group Indicator  
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[] call BIS_fnc_groupIndicator; // starts group indicator</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>["Exit"] call BIS_fnc_groupIndicator; // closes group indicator</sqf>
|seealso= [[Description.ext#showGroupIndicator|Description.ext showGroupIndicator]] [[Description.ext#showSquadRadar|Description.ext showSquadRadar]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= GUI
|descr=Creates cinematic borders. Player cannot move during cutscene.
|s1= [mode, duration, sound, view] call [[BIS_fnc_cinemaBorder]]
|p1= mode: [[Number]] - Can be: *0 - In *1 - Out |p2= duration: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1.5) Duration in seconds |p3= sound: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) Play sound |p4= view: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]] Lock 1st-person-view)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[1, 2, true, true ] call BIS_fnc_cinemaBorder;</sqf>
|seealso= [[disableUserInput]] [[userInputDisabled]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= GUI |eff= local |descr= [[File:BIS_fnc_textTiles.gif|right|400px]] Shows an animated text with background tiles. |s1= [content, position, tileSize, duration, fadeInOutTime, tileTransparency] spawn [[BIS_fnc_textTiles]] |p1= content: [[String]] or [[Structured Text]] * [[String]] - path to texure * [[Structured Text]] - formatted text |p2= position: [[Boolean]] or [[Array]] (optional, default [0, 0, 1, 1]) * [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to use ''mission area'' set in the layout options, [[false]] for full screen * [[Array]] - screen space coordinates in format [x, y, w, h] |p3= tileSize: [[Number]] or [[Array]] (optional, default 10 ([10,10]) * [[Number]] - tile size in screen space coordinates. Tile will be square * [[Array]] - tile size in screen space coordinates in format [w, h] |p4= duration: [[Number]] - (optional, default 5) duration in seconds |p5= fadeInOutTime: [[Number]] or [[Array]] - (optional, default 0) duration of the fade effect in seconds * [[Array]] - format [fadeIn, fadeOut] * [[Number]] - duration of the fadeIn/Out effect |p6= tileTransparency: [[Number]] - (optional, default 0.3) transparency or alpha value of the tiles. 0 means invisible and 1 fully visible |r1= [[Boolean]] - Returns always [[true]] |exec= spawn |x1= [parseText "MyMission
by Username", true, nil, 7, 0.7, 0] spawn BIS_fnc_textTiles; |x2= ["path\to\image.paa"] spawn BIS_fnc_textTiles; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_dynamicText]] [[BIS_fnc_infoText]] [[BIS_fnc_typeText]] [[BIS_fnc_typeText2]] [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_SITREP]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= GUI
|descr= Display a mission-specific titlecard before the mission begins. Only works the first time it is called.
|s1= [path, subtitle] call [[BIS_fnc_titlecard]]
|p1= path: [[String]] - Path to video
|p2= subtitle: [[String]] - (Optional, default "") Subtitle displayed|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>["\a3\missions_f_epb\video\b_out2_quotation.ogv", "your translation"] call BIS_fnc_titlecard;</sqf>
|seealso= [[allCutLayers]] [[titleRsc]] [[cutText]] [[cutObj]] [[cutFadeOut]] [[setTitleEffect]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Live Feed
|descr= Display a live feed.
|s1= [source, target, receiver, effect] call [[BIS_fnc_liveFeed]]
|p1= source: [[Object]] or [[Position]] - live feed source
|p2= target: [[Object]] or [[Position]] - live feed target
|p3= receiver: [[Object]] - player that will see the feed - if not [[Multiplayer Scripting#Locality|local]], function will do nothing
|p4= effect: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) live feed effect. Can be one of: * -1: reset *  0: normal *  1: night vision *  2: thermal imaging
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if successful, [[false]] if not
|x1= <sqf>[myUAV, player, player, 2] call BIS_fnc_liveFeed;</sqf>
|x2= live feed display: <sqf>private _UAVFeedDisplay = uiNamespace getVariable "BIS_fnc_PIP_RscPIP";</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedEffects]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetSource]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetTarget]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedTerminate]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Live Feed
|descr= Add effect to the current live feed.
|s1= effect call [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedEffects]]
|p1= effect: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) Live feed effect. Can be one of: * -1: reset *  0: normal *  1: night vision *  2: thermal imaging
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if successful, [[false]] if not
|x1= <sqf>1 call BIS_fnc_liveFeedEffects;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_liveFeed]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetSource]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetTarget]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedTerminate]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Live Feed
|descr= Set the source of the current live feed.
|s1= source call [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetSource]]
|p1= source: * [[Object]] * [[Position]] * [[Array]]: in the format [object, [x, y, z]]
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if successful, [[false]] if not
|x1= <sqf>[player, [0, 0.25, 1.6]] call BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetSource;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_liveFeed]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedEffects]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedSetTarget]] [[BIS_fnc_liveFeedTerminate]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= GUI |arg= global |eff= local |descr= Plays a fake UAV observational sequence which serves as an establishing shot.
[[File:BIS_fnc_establishingShot.gif|left|400px]] |s1= [target, text, altitude, radius, angle, rotation, iconOptions, mode, fadeIn,waitTime] spawn [[BIS_fnc_establishingShot]] |p1= target: [[Object]] or [[Array]] - Target or target's position |p2= text: [[String]] - (Optional, default "") Text to display |p3= altitude: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 500) Altitude in meters |p4= radius: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 200) Radius of the circular movement in meters |p5= angle: [[Number]] - (Optional, default random) Viewing angle in degrees |p6= rotation: [[Number]] - (Optional, default random) Direction of camera movement * 0: anti-clockwise * 1: clockwise |p7= iconOptions: [[Array]] - (Optional, default []) Each array in format: *0: icon: [[String]] - Path to icon texture *1: color: [[Array]] - Color in format [R,G,B,A] *2: target: [[Object]], [[Position]] or [[Group]] - Where the texture should be drawn *3: sizeX: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1) Size of icon in x *4: sizeY: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1) Size of icon in y *5: angle: [[Number]] - (Optional, default [[random]] 360) Angle of icon *6: text: [[String]] - (Optional, default "") Text displayed underneath the icon *7: shadow: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) ** 0 to draw now shadow ** 1 to draw a shadow |p8= mode: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) * 0: normal (Disables saving and sets {{hl|BIS_missionStarted}} to [[nil]]) * 1: world scenes |p9= fadeIn: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) Fade in after completion |p10= waitTime: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 2) Wait time in seconds after the shot has been completed |p10since= arma3 1.82 |r1= [[Boolean]] - true when done |x1= [player, "I can see my house from here", 500, 250, 75, 1, [], 0, true] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot; |x2= [ [5229.97,5233.07,0], "BLUFOR and OPFOR firefight", 500, 250, 75, 1, [ ["\A3\ui_f\data\map\markers\nato\b_inf.paa",[0,0.3,0.6,1],group_1,1,1,0,"BLUFOR"], ["\A3\ui_f\data\map\markers\nato\o_inf.paa",[0.5,0,0,1],group_2,1,1,0,"OPFOR"] ], 0, true, 15 ] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot; |exec= spawn |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_dynamicText]] [[Arma 3: Mission Presentation]] }}
Posted on January 28, 2018 - 02:01 (UTC)
[[User:Lou Montana|Lou Montana]]
Be aware that [[spawn]]ing this function will set [[enableSaving]] to true. Quick workaround: private _savingEnabled = savingEnabled; _handle = [player, "myText"] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot; waitUntil { scriptDone _handle }; enableSaving [_savingEnabled, false]; Or, if you can't wait the end of the establishing shot: private _savingEnabled = savingEnabled; _handle = [player, "myText"] spawn BIS_fnc_establishingShot; _handle spawn { waitUntil { scriptDone _this }; enableSaving [_savingEnabled, false]; };
Posted on July 30, 2019 - 12:01 (UTC)
[[User:R3vo|R3vo]]
In order to change the camera to TI or NVG mode execute the following right after [[BIS_fnc_establishingShot]] was spawned. true setCamUseTI 1; The effect will automatically be terminated once the establishing shot ended.
