{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Geometry |descr=Checks if a position lies within an angle sector.
[[Image: BIS_fnc_inAngleSector.jpg|700px]] |s1= [center, centerAngle, sectorWidth, position] call [[BIS_fnc_inAngleSector]] |p1= center : [[Array]] - Center position |p2= centerAngle : [[Number]] - Defines the center angle of the sector |p3= sectorWidth: [[Number]] - Defines the width of the sector in degrees |p4= position: [[Array]] - The position which should be checked |r1= [[Boolean]]: Returns [[true]] if the position lies within sector |x1=[ position player, getDir player, 30, position enemy_tank ] call BIS_fnc_inAngleSector; |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_isInFrontOf]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= FORMATION [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Player must stay within certain radius and angle towards followed vehicle.
|exec=spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [failCode, maxTime, relPos, diffAlt, visualize]
|p1= failCode: [[Number]] - Code executed if unit spends too long outside formation
|p2= maxTime: [[Number]] - Time required to be spent in formation (default: 0) * when > 0, waypoint is completed once maxTime was reached * when <= 0, waypoint is completed only when waypoint condition was met (always [[false]] in Function execution), and ''failCode'' is executed once ''maxTime'' is reached
|p3= relPos: [[Array]] - in format [relDist, relAngle]: * relDist: [[Number]] - required distance in meters from followed target (default: 100m) * relAngle [[Number]] - required relative angle in degrees from followed target (default: 180)
|p4= diffAlt: [[Number]] - Altitude tolerance in meters (default: -1)
|p5= visualize: [[Boolean]] - true to show hint (default: false)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, dude, 80, { HSim_keptFormation = false }, -60, [80,160], 20, true] spawn BIS_fnc_wpFormation;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|exec=spawn
|descr= TRANSPORT [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Player must pick up group of units in their location. Get in AI pathfinding is supressed (to avoid unwanted behaviour on building roofs), units are teleported into player's vehicle instead.
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: none
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, dude, 100] spawn BIS_fnc_wpTransport;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= HOVER [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]]. Hover on specific spot.
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [minTime, reset, altDiff, visualize]
|p1= minTime: [[Number]] - What time in seconds must be spent hovering before completion
|p2= reset: [[Boolean]] - Reset the timer every time you fail hovering
|p3= altDiff: [[Number]] - How far from the waypoint height must you hover (-1: altitude does not matter, only completionRadius does) (default: -1)
|p4= visualize: [[Boolean]] - true to show hint (default: false)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, position dude, 10, 10, false, -1, true] spawn BIS_fnc_wpLand;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|exec= spawn
|descr= DROP SLINGLOAD [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Drop an object which was previously loaded using [[BIS_fnc_wpSlingLoadAttach]]
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: none
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, position dude, 50] spawn BIS_fnc_wpSlingLoadDrop;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= RESTRICTED [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Player must fly in given limits.
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [limits, maxTime, failCode, visualize, warnCode]
|p1= failCode: [[Array]] - flight limits in format [minAlt, maxAlt, minSpeed, maxSpeed]: * minAlt: [[Number]] - minimal altitude in meters above ground level (default: -1) * maxAlt: [[Number]] - maximal altitude in meters above ground level (default: 60) * minSpeed: [[Number]] - minimal speed in km/h (default: -1) * maxSpeed: [[Number]] - maximal speed in km/h (default: -1)
|p2= maxTime: [[Number]] - how much time spent outside of the limits will lead to fail (default: -1)
|p3= failCode: [[Code]] - code executed when maxTime is reached (default: {})
|p4= visualize: [[Boolean]] - true to show hint (default: false)
|p5= warnCode: [[Code]] - code executed when unit get out of limits (default: {})
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, objNull, 0, [250, -1, 150, -1], 30, { HSim_RestrictedFlight = false }, true] spawn BIS_fnc_wpFormation;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|exec= spawn
|descr= FLY STEADY [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Keep helicopter's pitch, bank, relative velocity a relative vector in given limits
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [limitArray, failLimit, failCode, warningCode, positiveCode]
|p1= limitArray: [[Array]] - in format [deltaVelocity, deltaVector, vector]: * deltaVelocity: [[Number]] - how much can [[velocity]] change (default: 20) * deltaVector: [[Number]] - how much can vector direction change (default: 1.5) * vector: [[Number]] - absolute vector limits for pitch and bank in degrees (default: 45)
|p2= failLimit: [[Number]] - what time in seconds spent outside of limits will lead to fail (default: -1)
|p3= failCode: [[Code]] - code executed when waypoint fails - time spent outside of limits reached failLimit (default: {})
|p4= warningCode: [[Code]] - code [[spawn]]ed every time vehicle is outside of limits (default: {})
|p5= positiveCode: [[Code]] - code [[spawn]]ed every time vehicle is inside of limits (default: {})
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf> [ player, position dude, nil, [15,1.3,30], 10, { hintC "You failed"; }, { hint "Watch out!"; }, { hint "Good"; } ] spawn BIS_fnc_wpSteady; </sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|exec= spawn
|descr= WINCH LOAD [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Load a group into helicopter cargo using winch.
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [limitHeight, winchID, crewman, failCode, loadCode]
|p1= limitHeight: [[Number]] - height tolerance from waypoint's height (default: 10m)
|p2= winchID: [[Number]] - ID of vehicle's winch position. Positions are defined in vehicle's config under RopePositions >> Winch (default: 0)
|p3= crewman: [[Object]] - person going down on a rope (default: 2nd person in vehicle's [[crew]])
|p4= failCode: [[Code]] - code executed when anything happens to persons on rope (default: {})
|p5= loadCode: [[Code]] - code executed everytime person from a group is selected to be loaded into helicopter (default: {})
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, dude, 50, 5, 1, rescuer, {hintC "Rescuer died!"}, {hintC "Dude saved"}] spawn BIS_fnc_wpWinchLoad;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= CHECKPOINT [[Custom Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Player has to reach waypoint position with certain precision (as opposed to normal [[Mission Editor: Waypoints#Move|Move]] waypoint, which became completed in around 500m).
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [posLimit]
|p1= posLimit: [[Code]] - time in seconds unit is required to stay withing waypoint completion radius (default: -1)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, getPosASL dude, 10, 2] spawn BIS_fnc_wpCheckpoint;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= ATTACH SLINGLOAD [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Load an object to rope.
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [posLimit, failCode, weight]
|p1= posLimit: [[Number]] or [[Boolean]] - Time in seconds it takes to attach the cargo. When [[true]], cargo is attached immediately (default: -1)
|p2= failCode: [[Code]] - code executed if rope is cut by accident (e.g. collision with another object) (default: {})
|p3= weight: [[Number]] - cargo weight (default: model weight)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, dude, 50, 10, { hintC "You lost the cargo!" }, 1000] spawn BIS_fnc_wpSlingLoadAttach;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[player, dude, 0, true] spawn BIS_fnc_wpSlingLoadAttach; // attaches the cargo immediately</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|exec= spawn
|descr= COUNTDOWN [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Player has to reach waypoint area before time runs out.
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [failCode,timeLimit,showHint]
|p1= failCode: [[Code]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>{}</sqf> code executed when time runs oout before player reach the waypoint
|p2= timeLimit: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 30) limit in seconds
|p3= showHint: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to show info about time left
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, position dude, 100, { hintC "You failed!" }, 42, true] spawn BIS_fnc_wpTimed;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= FAST-ROPE [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Let everybody in vehicles' cargo space rappel down on a rope.
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [limitHeight,limitSpeed,fastropeID]
|p1= limitHeight: [[Number]] - height tolerance from waypoint's height (default: 10m)
|p2= limitSpeed: [[Number]] - maximum speed ov vehicle (default: 10km/h)
|p3= fastropeID: [[Number]] - ID of vehicle's fast-rope position. Positions are defined in vehicle's config under RopePositions >> Fastrope
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, position dude, 50, 5, 15, 1] spawn BIS_fnc_wpFastRope;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

revision.comment: Text replacement - "[[Custom_Waypoints#Function|arguments]]" to "[[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]"
revision.text:
{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= CIRCLE [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]]. Keep helicopter rotated in given vector toward target.
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [circleLimit, circleBorder, circleDir, customCond, hint]
|p1= circleLimit: [[Number]] - what time in seconds must be spent withing limit (default: 0)
|p2= circleBorder: [[Number]] - precision tolerance (smaller number means more precision) (default: 0.75)
|p3= circleDir: [[Number]] or [[Array]] - limit - direction or vector towards target (default: view of 2nd [[crew]] member - left (-90) or right (90))
|p4= customCond: [[Code]] - additional condition required for waypoint completion. Passed arguments are [_veh,_target]. (default: {[[true]]})
|p5= hint: [[String]] - [[format]]ted hint. %1 is value showing how precise current vector is (in percents), %2 is precent symbol "%1" (default: "%1%2")
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1=
|seealso= â€Ž[[:Category:Function Group: Waypoints|Waypoint functions]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Configs
|descr= Returns all subclasses within given class.
|s1= [config, depth, lastTier, firstTier] call [[BIS_fnc_returnChildren]]
|p1= config: [[Config]] - Class which is searched
|p2= depth: [[Number]] - Depth, (0 = return only subclasses, 1 = return subclasses of subclasses, and so on...
|p3= lastTier: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[false]] to return only the last one, [[true]] to return all classes
|p4= firstTier: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[true]] to return the first class, [[false]] to return only the last one
|r1= [[Array]] - Classes
|x1= <sqf>[configFile >> "CfgFunctions", 2] call BIS_fnc_returnChildren; // returns config paths of all functions</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_returnParents]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= DETACH SLINGLOAD [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Unload an object which was previously loaded using [[BIS_fnc_wpSlingLoadAttach]].
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [posLimit,limitDir]
|p1= posLimit: [[Number]] - Time in seconds it takes to detach the cargo (default: -1)
|p2= limitDir: [[Array]] - direction range in which cargo has to be detached (default: [0,360])
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, position dude, 50, 10, [42, 52]] spawn BIS_fnc_wpSlingLoadDetach;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.86
|gr1= Eden Editor
|descr= Export 3DEN mission to SQF script. When called, the script will dynamically recreate the mission.
|s1= [showWindow,exportLayers,center,checkBlacklist] call [[BIS_fnc_3DENExportSQF]]
|p1= showWindow: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[true]] to show window with script code
|p2= exportLayers: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[true]] to export layers as conditions (it's possible to create only specific layers using params passed to the exported script)
|p3= center: [[Array]] format [[Position]] - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) Center position, all entity positions will be exported as relative
|p4= checkBlacklist: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[false]]) [[true]] to export with check if specific entity ID was blacklisted
|r1= [[Array]] in form [[objects,groups,triggers,waypoints,logics,markers],[objectIDs,groupIDs,triggerIDs,waypointIDs,logicIDs,markerIDs]]
|x1= <sqf>[true, false, [1337,1337,0], true] call BIS_fnc_3DENExportSQF;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Eden Editor]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.62 |gr1= Campaign |gr2= GUI |eff= local |descr= Displays multiple lines of text in given order.
[[File:BIS_fnc_EXP camp SITREP.gif|400px]] |s1= [line1, line2, lineX] spawn [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_SITREP]] |p1= line#: [[Array]] - lines to be displayed. Each array consist of the following parameters: * 0: text: [[String]] - text to be displayed * 1: fadeInTime: [[Number]] - (optional, default 2) fade-in duration in seconds * 2: waitTime: [[Number]] - (optional, default 1) how many seconds to wait before showing the next line * 3: fadeOutTime: [[String]] - (optional, default 2) fade-out duration in seconds. It is only used by the last line. Fades all other lines as well |r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if successful, [[false]] if not |x1= [["line1", 4, 5], ["line2", 3, 5, 8]] spawn BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_SITREP; |exec= spawn |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_dynamicText]] [[BIS_fnc_infoText]] [[BIS_fnc_textTiles]] [[BIS_fnc_typeText2]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.78
|gr1= Interaction
|descr= Function that executes a user-defined code when a key has been held down for a long enough time.
|s1= [display, key, time, code, control] call [[BIS_fnc_holdKey]]
|p1= display: [[Display]] - display the event is attached to. By default it is the map display
|p2= key: [[Number]] - what key to press. See [[DIK KeyCodes]]
|p3= time: [[Number]] - how long the key has to be held down in seconds
|p4= code: [[Code]] - code to be executed when key is held down for long enough. [[canSuspend]] returns [[true]] inside the code
|p5= control: [[Control]] - (Optional, default [[controlNull]] - Text control to be used in place of the default "Press X to skip" control.
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[findDisplay 46, 36, 5, { hint "Key 'J' pressed for 5 seconds" }] call BIS_fnc_holdKey; // action is added to the mission display</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd]] [[addAction]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.58
|gr1= Eden Editor
|descr= Initialises a slider attribute control within the [[Eden Editor]]. Can also be used outside of [[Eden Editor]]. {{Feature|Informative| The slider and the edit control have to share the same controls group!}}
|s1= [ctrlSlider, ctrlEdit, unit, default] call [[BIS_fnc_initSliderValue]]
|p1= ctrlSlider: [[Control]] - Slider control, usually the first control within the controls group |p2= ctrlEdit: [[Control]] - Edit Box, usually the second control within the controls group |p3= unit: [[String]] - Measurement unit added behind the number within the edit box ("%" by default) |p4= default: [[Number]] - When present, only the value is set, functionality is not initialized
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[_this controlsGroupCtrl 100, _this controlsGroupCtrl 101, "m", 50] call BIS_fnc_initSliderValue;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Eden Editor: Configuring Attributes]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.98
|gr1= Old Man
|descr= Initialize slider with edit box showing its value supporting small decimal numbers.
|s1= [ctrlSlider, ctrlEdit, unit, defaultValue] call [[BIS_fnc_OM_Module_initSmallValueSilder]]
|p1= ctrlSlider: [[Control]] - Slider Control
|p2= ctrlEdit: [[Control]] - Edit Control
|p3= unit: [[String]] - (Optional, default "%") Measurement unit added behind the number
|p4= defaultValue: [[Number]] - (Optional, default nil) When present, only the value is set, functionality is not initialized
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf>[_ctrlSlider,_ctrlEdit,"m",500] call BIS_fnc_OM_Module_initSmallValueSilder;//Set default value only.</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[_ctrlSlider,_ctrlEdit,"m"] call BIS_fnc_OM_Module_initSmallValueSilder;//Initialize functionality.</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_initSliderValue]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.98
|gr1= Old Man
|descr= Saves the game - simply calls [[saveGame]].
|s1= call [[BIS_fnc_OM_saveGame]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>call BIS_fnc_OM_saveGame;</sqf>
|seealso= [[saveGame]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.98
|gr1= Old Man
|descr=
|s1= <!-- [] call [[BIS_fnc_OM_camera]] -->
|r1=
|x1=
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.98
|gr1= Object Manipulation
|descr= Draws bounding box around given objects.
|s1= [objects, color, draw] call [[BIS_fnc_drawBoundingBox]]
|p1= objects: [[Array]] - (Optional, default <sqf inline>[objNull]</sqf>) [[Array]] of [[Object]]s
|p2= color: [[Array]] in format [[Color|Color (RGBA)]] - (Optional, default [1,0,1,1])
|p3= draw: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default nil) [[true]] to draw, [[false]] to remove
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] is successful, [[false]] if not
|x1= <sqf>[[BIS_building], [1,0,1,1], true] call BIS_fnc_drawBoundingBox;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[[], [], false] call BIS_fnc_drawBoundingBox;</sqf>
|seealso= [[boundingBoxReal]] [[boundingBox]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Vectors
|descr= Divides vector by scalar, by dividing all vector elements. {{Feature|informative| [[vectorMultiply]] can be used instead as <sqf inline>vector vectorMultiply 1/scale</sqf>, but: * ''scale'' cannot be 0 * in some rare cases, the result is not ''exactly'' the same as [[BIS_fnc_vectorDivide]] - this is due to [[Floating Point Number]] precision and rounding. }}
|s1= [vector, divider] call [[BIS_fnc_vectorDivide]]
|p1= vector: [[Array]] of [[Number]]s - (Optional, default [0,0,0]) can be any array of numbers
|p2= divider: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1)
|r1= [[Array]] of [[Number]]s
|x1= <sqf>[[123, 456, 789], 5] call BIS_fnc_vectorDivide;</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>[[1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, 9], 5] call BIS_fnc_vectorDivide;</sqf>
|seealso= [[vectorMultiply]] [[BIS_fnc_vectorMultiply]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Event Handlers
|descr= Removes all scripted event handler with given name. Additionally "ScriptedEventHandlerRemoved" scripted EH is called for every removed event handler. {{Feature|informative|For a list of available scripted event handlers, see [[Arma 3: Scripted Event Handlers]].}}
|s1= [namespace, name] call [[BIS_fnc_removeAllScriptedEventHandlers]]
|p1= namespace: [[Namespace]], [[Object]], [[Group]], [[Location]], [[Boolean]], [[Control]] or [[Display]] - namespace in which handler is saved
|p2= name: [[String]] - handler name
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[false]] if never existed, [[true]] otherwise
|x1= <sqf>[missionNamespace, "event"] call BIS_fnc_removeAllScriptedEventHandlers;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_callScriptedEventHandler]] [[BIS_fnc_addScriptedEventHandler]] [[BIS_fnc_removeScriptedEventHandler]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma2 |version1= 1.00
|arg=
|eff=
|gr1= Modules
|descr= Function behind the [[Secondary Operations Manager]] module.
|s1= [secops, unit] call [[BIS_SOM_addSupportRequestFunc]]
|p1= secops: [[Array]] of [[String]]s - values can be: * "transport" * "aerial_reconnaissance" * "supply_drop" * "tactical_airstrike" * "artillery_barrage" * "gunship_run"
|p2= unit: [[Object]]
|r1=
|x1= <sqf>[["transport", "aerial_reconnaissance", "supply_drop", "tactical_airstrike", "artillery_barrage", "gunship_run"], player] call BIS_SOM_addSupportRequestFunc;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Secondary Operations Manager]] [[BIS_SOM_requestSecOpFunc]] [[:Category:Arma 2: Editor Modules|Arma 2: Editor Modules]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.78
|eff= local
|gr1= Map and Markers
|gr2= Event Handlers
|descr= Event handler function for locking the camera.
|s1= position call [[BIS_fnc_zoomLockEH]]
|p1= position: [[Position]] - Position that the camera should focus
|r1=
|x1= <sqf>[position player] call BIS_fnc_zoomLockEH;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_zoomLock]] [[BIS_fnc_zoomUnlock]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.94 |gr1= IDWMap |descr= 
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Returns currently set IDWMap params

	Parameter(s):
		NONE

	Returns:
		ARRAY in format: [[mapMinX, mapMinY, mapMaxX, mapMaxY], idwCellSize, idwSpreadRadius, idwSpreadPower, curvePointsInterval, curvePointSpreadRadius] 
		or 
		[] on error
		
	Example:
		call BIN_fnc_getIDWMapParams
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} {{Feature|arma3contact}} |s1= |p1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.94 |gr1= IDWMap |descr= 
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Sets static data for extension use from argument or config "CfgIDWMap"

	Parameter(s):
		ARRAY (optional) - static data in format:
		[
			[[x,y,strengh],[x,y,strengh],...], // data layer 0
			[[x,y,strengh],[x,y,strengh],...], // data layer 1
			...
			[[x,y,strengh],[x,y,strengh],...] // data layer N
		]

	Returns:
		BOOL - true on success
		
	Example:
		call BIN_fnc_setIDWMapStaticDataLayers
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} {{Feature|arma3contact}} |s1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.94 |gr1= Collisions |descr= 
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Returns stored area objects for diagnostics

	Parameter(s):
		0: STRING - area name
		1: NUMBER - multipart number

	Returns:
		ARRAY of arays in format [[posX,posY,posMinZ,posMaxZ,radius],...]
		
	Example:
		"MyArea" call BIN_fnc_diag_getAllAreaObjects
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} {{Feature|arma3contact}} |s1= |p1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.94 |gr1= IDWMap |descr= 
/*
		Killzone_Kid

	Description:
		Gets static data from extension

	Parameter(s):
		NONE

	Returns:
		ARRAY in format:
		[
			[[x,y,strengh],[x,y,strengh],...], // data layer 0
			[[x,y,strengh],[x,y,strengh],...], // data layer 1
			...
			[[x,y,strengh],[x,y,strengh],...] // data layer N
		]
		or 
		[] - on error

		
	Example:
		call BIN_fnc_getIDWMapStaticDataLayers
*/
{{Wiki|placeholder}} {{Feature|arma3contact}} |s1= |p1= |r1= |x1= |seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.62
|gr1= Campaign
|serverExec= server
|descr= Changes AI skill based on player count, responding to player connected / player disconnected events. This function does exactly the same as [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_setSkill]] execept that it automatically executes when a player joins or disconnects.
|s1= [mode, affectedSides] call [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_dynamicAISkill]]
|p1= mode: [[Boolean]] - (Optional, default [[true]]) [[true]] to enable, [[false]] to disable
|p2= affectedSides: [[Array]] - Array of affected sides and their skill sets. For details see [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_setSkill]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf> [ true, [ [WEST, 0.1, 0.2, 0.7, 0.6], [EAST, 0.1, 0.2, 0.7, 0.6] ] ] call BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_dynamicAISkill; </sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma 3 AI Skill]] [[setSkill]] [[skillFinal]] [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_setSkill]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.62
|gr1= GUI
|descr= Displays the given subtitles at the correctly defined moments. Each array added to the parameters represents one subtitle. {{Feature | Informative | Subtitles can be cancel by setting {{hl|BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles_terminate}} to [[true]].}}
|s1= [subtitleDetail1, subtitleDetail2, ...] spawn [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles]]
|p1= subtitleDetailN: [[Array]] - format [speaker, text, timing]: * speaker: [[String]] - Name of the speaker * text: [[String]] - Subtitle * timing: [[Number]] - Time at which the subtitle is played
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if successful, [[false]] if not
|x1= <sqf>[ ["CROSSROAD", "Mission is a go, I repeat, mission is a go! Crossroad, out.", 0] ] spawn BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles; // Shows a subtitle immediately</sqf> |x2= <sqf>[ ["Speaker1", "Subtitle1", 0], ["Speaker2", "Subtitle2", 5], ["Speaker3", "Subtitle3", 10], ["Speaker4", "Subtitle5", 15] ] spawn BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles; // Displays 4 subtitles with 5 seconds between them</sqf>
|exec= spawn |Execution By (defaults to [[call]] if omitted)=
|seealso= [[Conversations]] [[BIS_fnc_showSubtitle]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|game2= arma3 |version2= 0.50
|gr1= GUI
|descr= Returns IDD of given display.
|s1= [config, ctrlName] call [[BIS_fnc_getIDC]]
|p1= config: [[Config]] - Config path to display |p2= ctrlName: [[String]] - Config name of [[Control|control]]
|r1= [[Number]] - IDC, returns -1 if control was not found
|x1= <sqf>private _IDC = [configFile >> "Display3DENPlace", "ButtonCancel"] call BIS_fnc_getIDC;</sqf>
|seealso= [[configFile]] [[findDisplay]] [[createDisplay]] [[displayCtrl]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.42
|gr1= Systems
|descr= Function that adds dynamic groups to the mission as seen in End Game. Function needs to be initialized on server and client. Clients can then use action TeamSwitch ("U" by default) to access the Dynamic Groups interface.
|s1= [mode, params] call [[BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups]]
|p1= mode: [[String]] - mode, can be: * "Initialize" - Initializes dynamic groups on the server * "Terminate" - Terminates dynamic groups on the server * "InitializePlayer" - Does client side initialization * "TerminatePlayer" - Does client side termination * "IsInitialized" - Checks whether dynamic groups was initialized * "RegisterGroup" - Registers a group * "UnregisterGroup" - Unregisters a group * "IsGroupRegistered" - Whether a group was already registered or not * "SetName" - Sets the name of the group, in future, will also update GroupId of the group * "SetPrivateState" - Set the private state of a group * "SwitchLeader" - Switches the leader of given group to the given player * "AddGroupMember" - Add a group member to group * "RemoveGroupMember" - Switches a player from one group to another * "KickPlayer" - Kicks a player from group, player wont be able to join the group unless invited or is unkicked using UnKickPlayer * "UnKickPlayer" - Unkicks a player from a group * "WasPlayerKickedFrom" - Whether given player was kicked from given group * "GetAllGroups" - Returns all registered and valid groups
|p2= params: [[Array]] - parameter changes according to {{hl|mode}}. Check the function in the Functions Viewer for detailed information
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>["Initialize"] call BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups; // exec on Server</sqf>
|x2= <sqf>["InitializePlayer", [player]] call BIS_fnc_dynamicGroups; // exec on client</sqf>
|seealso= [[Dynamic Groups]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.62
|gr1= Inventory
|descr= Returns true if given magazine is throwable
|s1= magazine call [[BIS_fnc_isThrowable]]
|p1= magazine: [[String]] - magazine class name
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if throwable
|x1= <sqf>private _isThrowable = "SmokeShellGreen" call BIS_fnc_isThrowable;</sqf>
|seealso= [[magazines]] [[currentThrowable]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.62
|gr1= Interaction
|descr= Removes a hold action. This does exactly the same as [[removeAction]].
|s1= [target,ID] call [[BIS_fnc_holdActionRemove]]
|p1= target: [[Object]] - Object the action is attached to
|p2= ID: [[Number]] - Action ID
|x1= <sqf>[ player,10 ] call BIS_fnc_holdActionRemove;</sqf>
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_holdActionAdd]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.58
|arg= global|gr1= Tasks
|descr= Returns type of given task. {{Feature|Informative| See [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] for more information.}}
|s1= taskID call [[BIS_fnc_taskType]]
|p1= taskID: [[String]] - Task ID
|r1= [[String]] - Task type or type 'Default' if not defined.
|x1= <sqf>["BIS_Task_01"] call BIS_fnc_taskType;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.58
|arg= global|eff= global|gr1= Tasks
|descr= Flags task to be or not to be always visible. {{Feature|Informative| See [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] for more information.}}
|s1= [taskID,alwaysVisible] call [[BIS_fnc_taskSetAlwaysVisible]]
|p1= taskID: [[String]] - Task ID
|p2= alwaysVisible: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] for always visible [[false]] if not
|r1= [[String]] - Task ID.
|x1= <sqf>["BIS_Task_01",true] call BIS_fnc_taskSetAlwaysVisible;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.60
|gr1= Respawn
|eff= global
|descr= Disables respawn loadout, role or position for [[Arma 3: Respawn]]. * Only role or only loadout can be limited at one moment, if there is limit for both, then only role uses limit. * If the limit definition for role is called multiple times with different numbers, then the highest number is used. * If disabling a position then respawnReference must be supplied
|s1= [mode, uiControl, listboxItem, message, respawnReference] call [[BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem]]
|p1= '''mode''': [[String]] - Available options are ''disable'', ''enable'' and ''state'' |p2= '''uiControl''': [[Control]] - List in which item should be disabled/enabled *BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlLocList *BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlRoleList *BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlComboLoadout |p3= '''listboxItem''': [[Number]] or [[String]] - Index or name of item in the respawn loadout/role/position listbox |p4= '''message''': [[String]] - Message shown when disabled item is selected, use "" for default message |p5= '''respawnReference''': [[String]] - Reference to respawn position either Marker name or [[vehicleVarName|Object var name]]
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[ "disable", uiNamespace getVariable "BIS_RscRespawnControlsMap_ctrlLocList", 2, "Restricted for this part of mission!", myRespawnModule call BIS_fnc_objectVar ] call BIS_fnc_showRespawnMenuDisableItem;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_addRespawnInventory]] [[BIS_fnc_addRespawnPosition]] [[Arma 3: Respawn]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.58
|gr1= Tasks
|descr= Returns path to the icon texture associated with given task type. {{Feature|Informative| See [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] for more information.}}
|s1= [type, default] call [[BIS_fnc_taskTypeIcon]]
|p1= type: [[String]] - Task type
|p2= default: [[Config]] - Config path to get default path from, if '''type''' does not exist
|r1= [[String]] - Path to the task type texture.
|x1= <sqf>["attack",configFile >> "CfgTaskTypes" >> "Run" >> "icon"] call BIS_fnc_taskTypeIcon;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= GUI
|descr= Displays a subtitle at the bottom of the screen. {{Feature|informative|If you want to play more subtitles, or want them to be played at a certain time, it might be easier to use [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles]].}}
|s1= [name, subtitle] spawn [[BIS_fnc_showSubtitle]]
|p1= name: [[String]] - name of the speaker
|p2= subtitle: [[String]] - subtitle to display
|r1= [[Script]] - Script controlling the displayed subtitle.
|x1= <sqf>["CROSSROAD", "Mission is a go, I repeat, mission is a go, Crossroad, out."] spawn BIS_fnc_showSubtitle;</sqf>
|exec= spawn
|seealso= [[Conversations]] [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_playSubtitles]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.58
|arg= global|eff= global|gr1= Tasks
|descr= Sets task type to given task. {{Feature|Informative| See [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] for more information.}}
|s1= [taskID,type] call [[BIS_fnc_taskSetType]]
|p1= taskID: [[String]] - Task ID
|p2= taskType: [[String]] - Task Type from [[configfile]] >> "CfgTaskTypes"
|r1= [[String]] - Task ID.
|x1= <sqf>["BIS_Task_01","attack"] call BIS_fnc_taskSetType;</sqf>
|seealso= [[Arma 3: Task Framework]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Weapons
|descr= Return addon from CfgPatches to which a given weapon class belongs to. {{Feature | important | This function is quite performance heavy, use only when absolutely necessary!}}
|s1= classname call [[BIS_fnc_weaponAddon]]
|p1= classname [[String]] - weapon's classname
|r1= [[String]] - addon's config name
|x1= <sqf>"arifle_MX_F" call BIS_fnc_weaponAddon; // returns "A3_Weapons_F_Rifles_MX"</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00 |gr1= Weapons |descr= Returns array with classname of the parent weapon (without attachments), followed by classnames of all its attachments.
{{Feature | important | The returned classnames are all converted to lower cases.}} |s1= [classname] call [[BIS_fnc_weaponComponents]] |p1= classname: [[String]] - Classname of the parent weapon |r1= [[Array]] |x1= "arifle_mx_aco_pointer_f" call BIS_fnc_weaponComponents; // ["arifle_mx_f","optic_aco","acc_pointer_ir"] |x2= "arifle_mx_gl_black_hamr_pointer_f" call BIS_fnc_weaponComponents; // ["arifle_mx_gl_black_f","optic_hamr","acc_pointer_ir"] |x3= "arifle_mx_black_f" call BIS_fnc_weaponComponents; // ["arifle_mx_f"] |seealso= }}

|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.84
|gr1= Boat Recovery

|s1= [[BIS_fnc_BoatRack01ActionCondition]]
|r1=

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Briefing
|descr= Selects a diary subject. {{Feature|informative|This was a temporary replacement for [[selectDiarySubject]] scripting command which '''had been broken''' until v2.04.}}
|s1= [diaryName] call [[BIS_fnc_selectDiarySubject]]
|p1= diaryName: [[String]] - Diary subject name
|r1= [[Boolean]] - [[true]] if the subject was found and selected
|x1= <sqf>["someSubject"] call BIS_fnc_selectDiarySubject;</sqf>
|seealso= [[processDiaryLink]] [[createDiaryLink]] [[createDiarySubject]] [[diarySubjectExists]] [[selectDiarySubject]] }}

{{RV|type=function |game1= arma2oa |version1= 1.50 |game2= tkoh |version2= 1.00 |game3= arma3 |version3= 0.50 |gr1= GUI |eff= local |descr= Shows dynamic opening credits or any type of text.
[[File:BIS_fnc_dynamicText_v2.gif|left|400px]] |s1= [text, x, y, duration, fadeInTime, deltaY, rscLayer] spawn [[BIS_fnc_dynamicText]] |p1= text: [[String]] - text to display |p2= x: [[Number]] or [[Array]] - (Optional, default -1) * [[Number]] - Position in x * [[Array]] ** 0: Position in x ** 1: Width of the control |p3= y: [[Number]] or [[Array]] - (Optional, default -1) * [[Number]] - Position in y * [[Array]] ** 0: Position in y ** 1: Height of the control |p4= duration: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 4) display duration |p5= fadeInTime: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 1) fade-in time |p6= deltaY: [[Number]] - (Optional, default 0) Y position delta: * = 0: Text will not move * > 0: Text will move down * < 0: Text will move up ''duration'' and the absolute ''deltaY'' value will influence the movement speed. |p7= rscLayer: [[Number]] - resource layer |r1= [[Nothing]] |x1= ["Warning!
Stop doing what you are doing",-1,-1,4,1,0,789] spawn BIS_fnc_dynamicText; |exec= spawn |seealso= [[BIS_fnc_infoText]] [[BIS_fnc_textTiles]] [[BIS_fnc_typeText]] [[BIS_fnc_typeText2]] [[BIS_fnc_EXP_camp_SITREP]] }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= AEROBATICS [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]].
Player must perform all the required manoeuvres: * "hover_turn_360" * "hover_bow" * "fast_turn_180" * "backwards" * "strafe"
|exec= spawn
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|Custom Waypoint arguments]]: [visuals, detectionCode, completionCode]
|p1= visuals: [[Boolean]] - should [[BIS_fnc_dynamicText|dynamic text]] appear on startup and completion
|p2= detectionCode: [[Code]] - code executed once the helicopter is ready ([[speed]] < 10 km/h)
|p3= completionCode: [[Code]] - code executed on manoeuvre's success (under 15s) <sqf> private ["_helicopter", "_manoeuvreName"]; _helicopter = _this select 0; _manoeuvreName = _this select 1; </sqf>
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, { hint "OK, start!" }, { hint "success!" }] spawn BIS_fnc_wpAerobatics;</sqf>
|seealso= }}

{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 2.10
|gr1= Environment
|eff= global
|serverExec= server
|descr= A helper function for setting [[rainParams]] in multiplayer. The call to the function could be placed in [[Event Scripts#init.sqf|init.sqf]] to sync [[rainParams]] between all clients and JIP. Alternatively execute on server.
|s1= rainParams [[call]] [[BIS_fnc_setRain]]
|p1= rainParams: [[Array]] or [[Config]] - custom [[Arma_3:_CfgWorlds_Config_Reference#class_RainParticles | RainParticles]] params, see [[rainParams]]. Use empty array [] or [[configNull]] to reset to default values
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|x1= <sqf> 0 setOvercast 1; 0 setRain 1; 0 setFog 0.1; // snow affects visibility at distance setHumidity 0.9; // don't want to see dust clouds enableEnvironment [false, true]; // don't want to see snakes and butterflies either forceWeatherChange; [ "a3\data_f\rainnormal_ca.paa", // rainDropTexture 1, // texDropCount 0.01, // minRainDensity 15, // effectRadius 0.1, // windCoef 2, // dropSpeed 0.5, // rndSpeed 0.5, // rndDir 0.02, // dropWidth 0.02, // dropHeight [0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 1], // dropColor 0.1, // lumSunFront 0.1, // lumSunBack 5.5, // refractCoef 0.3, // refractSaturation true, // snow false // dropColorStrong ] call BIS_fnc_setRain; </sqf>
|seealso= [[rainParams]] [[setRain]] }}

{{TabView|selected= 2
|title1= {{TabView/GameTitle|tkoh}} |content1=
{{RV|type=function
|game1= tkoh |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= "LAND" [[Custom_Waypoints|custom waypoint]]. Land on specific spot.
|s1= [[Custom Waypoints#Function|arguments]]: [dirParam, visualize]
|p1= dirParam: [[Array]] - in format [dir, dirDiff]: * dir: [[Number]] - required landing direction in degrees * dirDiff: [[Number]] - direction tolerance (to both sides)
|p2= visualize: [[Boolean]] - true to show hint (default: false)
|r1= [[Nothing]]
|x1= <sqf>[player, position dude, 10, [42, 20], true] spawn BIS_fnc_wpLand;</sqf>
|exec= spawn
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_scriptedWaypointType]] [[BIS_fnc_wpTransport]] }}
|title2= {{TabView/GameTitle|arma3}} |content2=
{{RV|type=function
|game1= arma3 |version1= 1.00
|gr1= Waypoints
|descr= Let group members land at the waypoint position.
|s1= [group, position, target] spawn [[BIS_fnc_wpLand]]
|p1= group: [[Group]] - group which is supposed to land
|p2= position: [[Position]] - waypoint position
|p3= target: [[Object]] - object the waypoint is attached to
|r1= [[Boolean]]
|exec= spawn
|x1= <sqf>[group player, [0,0,0], BIS_vehicle] spawn BIS_fnc_wpLand;</sqf>
|seealso= [[BIS_fnc_scriptedWaypointType]] [[BIS_fnc_wpTransport]] }}
}}
